Title: Data Engineer - Power & Utilities - Senior - Consulting - Location Open
Description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.

EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities.

EY is seeking a motivated professional with solid experience in the industrials, energy or utilities sector to serve as a Senior AI Data Engineer who possesses a robust background in AI, Gen AI, Agentic AI, preferably with an electrical engineering background. The ideal candidate will have a history of working for consulting companies and be well-versed in the fast-paced culture of consulting work. This role is dedicated to the industrials, energy, and utilities sector, where the successful candidate will craft, deploy, and maintain large-scale AI data architectures.

The opportunity

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be at the forefront of designing and implementing analytics solutions that drive substantial business value. You'll work closely with a diverse group of stakeholders to translate complex business requirements into precise technical specifications. Your role is crucial in bridging the gap between business needs and technical solutions, ensuring the successful execution of data-driven projects.

Your Key Responsibilities

In this role, you will design, develop, and maintain scalable data architectures, both on-premises and in the cloud. You'll manage the efficient storage, integration, validation, and security of data throughout its lifecycle. Your contributions will be vital to the delivery of processes, solutions, or projects, requiring you to exercise judgment and select appropriate methodologies to inform recommendations. You will be responsible for meeting your own targets, which will impact the performance of your team, and may guide junior colleagues to achieve project deliverables.


Design and implement scalable data architectures
Ensure efficient data lifecycle management
Contribute to the delivery of key projects and solutions
Architect and refine AI data architecture and modern data pipelines, integrating agentic AI solutions for clients in the industrials, energy, or power and utility sectors.
Leveraging your knowledge of industrials, energy or power and utility systems and processes to define data requirements, gather, profile and analyze large scale structured and unstructured source data, and develop AI/GenAI/Agentic AI solutions
Develop the mechanisms to ingest, analyze, validate, normalize, and clean data to support standardization, customization and ad hoc data analysis needs
Evaluate and implement cutting-edge tools and methodologies to enhance data engineering productivity.
Collaborate with a diverse team of business analysts, solution architects, and data scientists to develop strategic enterprise solutions and data products.


Skills And Attributes For Success

To excel in this role, you should demonstrate expertise in cloud computing, data architecture design, data integration, and software engineering. Your ability to manage relationships, think critically, and adapt with emotional agility will be key to your success.


A deep understanding of the value chain and core processes within the energy, or power systems sectors.
Proficiency in AI, GenAI/Agentic AI, relational SQL databases, DevOps, continuous integration, and data lake concepts.
A proven ability to design and maintain complex data integrations and ETL pipelines.
Strong organizational skills, capable of leading projects across globally distributed teams.
Exceptional communication skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex data issues.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define technical specifications
Participate in client sessions and lead workstream teams
Manage resource plans, budgets, and project statuses


To qualify for the role, you must have


A Bachelor’s degree in electrical/Power Systems Engineering, AI, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
At least 5 years of experience in data engineering, AI, and analytics.
At least 5 years of experience in the power and utilities sector.
A track record of implementing complex data solutions and familiarity with cloud services, data engineering programming languages, and data architecture.
Demonstrated understanding and experience using:
AI, GenAI/Agentic AI
Relational SQL databases
DevOps and continuous integration
Microsoft Fabric, Databricks/Snowflake
GitHub
Experience in cloud computing, data architecture design, data integration, and software engineering
Professional certifications as defined by service line policies
Relationship management skills
Critical thinking and emotional agility


Ideally, you’ll also have


Proven ability to navigate complex issues and make informed decisions
Experience in supervising and guiding junior team members
Demonstrated participation in sales opportunities and RFP responses
Leadership experience with a focus on team development and mentorship.
A passion for leveraging emerging technologies to address real-world problems.
A commitment to creating an inclusive work environment that celebrates diversity.


What We Look For

We seek top performers with a keen eye for detail, a passion for data-driven solutions, and the ability to thrive in a collaborative environment. Your proactive approach to problem-solving, combined with your technical expertise, will set you apart as a candidate.

FY25NATAID

What We Offer

We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The base salary range for this job in all geographic locations in the US is $105,100 to $192,700. The salary range for New York City Metro Area, Washington State and California (excluding Sacramento) is $126,100 to $218,900. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Join us in our team-led and leader-enabled hybrid model. Our expectation is for most people in external, client serving roles to work together in person 40-60% of the time over the course of an engagement, project or year. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.


Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.


EY accepts applications for this position on an on-going basis. If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

EY is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities including veterans with disabilities. If you have a disability and either need assistance applying online or need to request an accommodation during any part of the application process, please call 1-800-EY-HELP3, select Option 2 for candidate related inquiries, then select Option 1 for candidate queries and finally select Option 2 for candidates with an inquiry which will route you to EY’s Talent Shared Services Team (TSS) or email the TSS at ssc.customersupport@ey.com.

The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
3Si is a software (SaaS) company that helps governments, nonprofits, and philanthropies use data to improve the lives of children. We work with a network of state and city governments to build data systems that help identify and address early childhood service gaps. Founded in 2012, 3Si is a mission driven organization with a collaborative, entrepreneurial, innovative, and fully remote work culture.




We are growing and seeking a mission driven Senior Data Analyst to join our Business Intelligence team. Ideal candidates will have exceptional technical, analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills, growth-mindset, and interest to make a positive impact.




This is a fully REMOTE position. Only applicants who currently reside in California, Colorado, Oregon, and Washington State will be considered for this role.




The Sr. Data Analyst plays a critical role in extracting, analyzing, and interpreting data to assist customers with use of the 3Si CUSP platform to provide valuable insights that contribute to informed decision making. This role will support workstreams that demand high-level quantitative skills to inform project data analyses and client data requests. This position works collaboratively across the organization and with external stakeholders.




What You Will Do

Contribute to the production of professional, thorough, rigorous analyses and outputs for clients and external stakeholders, including formal reports, presentations, and dashboards.
Design, build, and maintain flexible data models from various sources based on customer requests, including CUSP and other third-party sources, investigate and design integration and analytics.
Conduct data preparation tasks that include data inventory and assessments of data completeness and quality.
Conduct exploratory analysis of source data from clients and help architect integration across complex data systems in the implementation of CUSP products in client cloud environments.
Identify and address data discrepancies; troubleshoot data-quality issues, validate outputs, recommend, and implement process and performance improvements for data.
Analyze, synthesize, and communicate complex data-related issues to both internal colleagues and external clients.
Implement and draft "Analytics Snapshot" for monthly data report cards, including a specific analysis of clients' internal data or CUSP outputs. Write analytical narratives describing the analysis goals, methodology, findings, limitations, avenues for future analysis, relevance to clients.
Provide client management support by engaging and communicating with clients and contributing to client meetings. Ensure that deliverables are on time and client ready.
Collaborate with cross-functional team to understand data requirements and business needs; partner with engineering and product management teams in the implementation, operation and use of 3Si products for clients.
Stay current with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analytics and visualization best practices and techniques.

Requirements

What You Will Bring

Bachelor’s degree or greater in a relevant field (e.g. Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Systems).
Five or more years’ experience in a consulting, research, data analytics, or similar.
Proficient with data analysis tools such as SQL, R, SPSS, Stata, SAS
Experience with at least one high-level programming language such as Python, Scala, Go
Experience in data modeling with relational and non-relational data
Significant experience designing and building data visualization solutions to customer requirements using data querying and visualization/reporting tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
Working knowledge of modern cloud-based data processing platforms such as Spark, Databricks, Snowflake, dbt
Familiarity with data science libraries such as NumPy, Pandas, Tensorflow
Proficiency in MS Office Suite required.
Strong consultative and project management skills
Solid ability to problem-solve and operate with analytical ambiguity.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to utilize multiple communication methods and styles to best reach target audience.
Exceptional organizational and time management skills.
Meticulous attention to detail to ensure accuracy in data analysis.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.

3Si Perks

3Si offers a professional and fun work environment. We recognize and value our employees and strive to create a supportive environment for our team. Here are some of the "perks" we provide to ensure our employees can thrive:

Competitive compensation with base salary range of $115- 145K, plus annual bonus plan.
100% Company sponsored Medical, Dental, Vision, STD, EAP, and voluntary life/ad&d plans.
Paid Time Off starting at 3 weeks per year and 11 paid holidays.
401k retirement plan + match
Career development opportunities




3Si provides equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, ancestry, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other basis protected by state or federal law.

Show more

Title: Customs Data Analytics Specialist
Description:
Job Description

LeadStack Inc. is an award winning, one of the nation's fastest growing, certified minority owned (MBE) staffing services provider of contingent workforce. As a recognized industry leader in contingent workforce solutions and Certified as a Great Place to Work, we're proud to partner with some of the most admired Fortune 500 brands in the world.




Job Title: Associate Manager Customs Data Analytics/ Customs Data Analytics Specialist

Location : : Hybrid - Seattle, WA

Duration : 6+ Months

Pay rate : $66/hr on W2

Job ID: 25-02508

Must be local




Technology requirements:

• Excel, PowerPoint

• Miro

• Power BI

• Visio

• Oracle EBS

• SQL, Alteryx, Tableau




Job Description –

This job contributes to ** success by guiding business decisions through discovering and sharing insights that deliver stakeholder outcomes.

You will be able to apply research, statistics, experimental design, synthesize, analyze, and implement and deploy models, dashboards, and storytelling presentations that support ** Global lines of business.

This role is focused on embedding analytics into customs processes and creating a data-driven strength which drives visibility and process improvements.

Models and acts in accordance with ** guiding principles.




Daily Responsibilities:

• Data Preparation: Under guidance of more senior partners, execute extraction and cleansing, and analysis of data from various databases, including Incorta, SQL server, Oracle EBS, Oracle GTM, and third party sources; perform exploratory data analysis, cleanse, massage, and aggregate data.

• Data Visualization: Work under consultative or self-initiated direction to assess and produce relevant, standard, or custom information (reports, charts, graphs and tables) from data sources by querying data repositories and generating the associated information. Familiar with common communication and data presentation and storytelling skills.

• Data manipulation and modeling: Ability to procure and manipulate large-scale, complex data from a variety of systems, experience reshaping data to ensure it is in right structure for analysis, filtering, normalizing, and evaluating outliers. Demonstrated experience with data and analytics solutions.

• Data methodologies and analysis: Applicable business experience and the ability to handle and maintain the confidentiality of highly sensitive information required for analysis and modeling, dashboard building, with proficiency in Excel, SQL, SAS, Tableau / PowerBI, and other design platforms. Uses data methodologies and skills in accordance with business applicability and insights operationalization.

• Business Understanding: Has working knowledge and understanding of ** business, and business acumen in general. Requires mentoring and guidance, but over time can make more of the connection between data and business applicability.

• Participates in discussions with business partners to consult and clarify define business questions. Provides analytic support (business requirements, documentation, data analysis, user acceptance testing, etc.) to IT to drive outcomes of technical implementations. Has outstanding collaboration skills with colleagues at all levels of the organization

• Insights Operationalization: Effectively presents complex technical material to non-technical audiences in an approachable way. Provide analytic support (code documentation, data transformations, process maps, etc.) to implement rules and model insights and recommendations into business processes.




Degree or certifications required?

• BA/BS with concentration in business, information systems, or management information systems




Required background? Skills?

• Ability to apply knowledge of multidisciplinary business principles and practices to achieve successful outcomes in cross-functional projects and activities

• Advanced skills in Excel, Miro, Power BI, PowerPoint, Visio, Oracle EBS, and other relevant applications to this role

• Exposure and business-applicable experience in data query and transformation tools including SQL, Alteryx, and Tableau

• Experience with business requirements gathering user acceptance testing, process documentation, and business process improvement




know more about current opportunities at LeadStack , please visit us on https://leadstackinc.com/careers/

Should you have any questions, feel free to call me on (513) 3184502 or send an email on waseem.ahmad@leadstackinc.com

Title: Data Engineer, People Analytics (2 year LTE)
Description:
The Foundation

We are the largest nonprofit fighting poverty, disease, and inequity around the world. Founded on a simple premise: people everywhere, regardless of identity or circumstances, should have the chance to live healthy, productive lives. We believe our employees should reflect the rich diversity of the global populations we aim to serve. We provide an exceptional benefits package to employees and their families which include comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage with no premiums, generous paid time off, paid family leave, foundation-paid retirement contribution, regional holidays, and opportunities to engage in several employee communities. As a workplace, we’re committed to creating an environment for you to thrive both personally and professionally.

The Team

In the People function, we are inspired by our mission “All Lives Have Equal Value” and are compelled by the opportunity to make an impact. Along with our partners, we take on complex challenges, continually test new approaches, and embrace change where it will facilitate the best outcome. We are on a mission to evolve how we work by pushing for greater transparency so people have access to information they need to make decisions, creating energy to support a thriving workforce, and showing respect so everyone can bring their best, authentic self to work every day.

Your Role

You are responsible for helping to craft and implement analytics-driven solutions for the foundation’s most pressing human capital priorities. You support the foundation’s organizational and team efficiency work, headcount planning and management, and workforce analytics. You deliver the output of multivariate cross-purpose analyses into useful insights that enable the foundation to improve its processes and decision-making strategies. You craft, build, and maintain HR’s workforce data pipeline and all business intelligence products that leverage workforce data. You will serve as a key partner and consultant to leadership within HR, Operations and with cross-foundation leadership.

What You’ll Do


Design, document, implement and maintain business intelligence products in support of cross-functional workforce analytics initiatives including headcount management, operations, HR, and internal communications reporting needs.
Partner with analytics, HRIS, and business teams to maintain and improve the data models that feed business intelligence tools and other workforce data and reporting needs across the organization.
Develop and maintain scalable data pipelines and build out new API integrations to support ongoing data, analysis and reporting needs.
Perform investigation and analysis required to troubleshoot data and system related issues and assists in the resolution of those issues.
Use data and analysis methodologies to address business questions or problems and uncover insights that support foundation leaders in making strategic, data-informed decisions.
Provide ad hoc data, analysis, and reporting (data visualization) results in support of foundation programs, policies or initiatives. Present resulting analysis, context and key insights to senior leaders.
Build technical documents and white papers summarizing analytics research projects, including executive summaries for presentation to senior and executive leadership.
Partner with IT and Director of People Data & Technology to develop strategy for long term data platform architecture.
Support inclusive culture through modeling behaviors and actions; call out issues in a timely fashion to appropriate partners.



Your Experience


A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent proven experience, preferably in quantitative social or physical science, statistics, data analytics, mathematics, or computer science.
5+ years of experience in people analytics or other relevant sector with exposure to people/HR data or other critical data types
Familiarity with descriptive and basic inferential statistics to understand usage behaviors and generate and test hypotheses.
Intermediate experience and proficiency in a variety of analytical platforms, software languages, and statistical tools: Microsoft Office, data warehouse and management tools (e.g. Azure, SQL, AWS, Redshift), data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau), data preparation and manipulation tools (e.g. MS Fabric, Alteryx, Python, Databricks), enterprise survey platform administration and utilization (e.g. Qualtrics, UKG, Culture Amp, Glint), and multivariate statistical platforms and/or languages (R, SAS, Stata, SPSS).
Intermediate experience in people analytics or another relevant sector with exposure to human resources data or other sensitive data types.
Experience using appropriate statistical techniques to mitigate bias, interpret statistical significance, and establish sufficient sample size.
Experience applying and integrating descriptive and basic predictive analyses to develop strategic and operational insights for human resources and organization-wide decision-making.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with experience distilling and communicating sophisticated data analyses and insights to large and small, technical and non-technical, audiences.
Ability to navigate ambiguity, apply prudent judgment, and implement proactively with multiple partners across various levels of the organization.
Must be able to legally work in the country where this position is located without visa sponsorship.



The salary range for this role is $127,400 to $191,200 USD. We recognize high-wage market differences in Seattle and Washington D.C., where our offices are located. The range for this role in these locations is $138,900 to $208,300 USD. As a mission-driven organization, we strive to balance competitive pay with our mission. New hires salaries are typically between the range minimum and the salary range midpoint. Actual placement in the range will depend on a candidate’s job-related skills, experience, and expertise, as evaluated during the interview process.

Hiring Requirements

As part of our standard hiring process for new employees, employment will be contingent upon successful completion of a background check.

Candidate Accommodations

If you require assistance due to a disability in the application or recruitment process, please submit a request here.

Inclusion Statement

We are dedicated to the belief that all lives have equal value. We strive for a global and cultural workplace that supports ever greater diversity, equity, and inclusion — of voices, ideas, and approaches — and we support this diversity through all our employment practices.

All applicants and employees who are drawn to serve our mission will enjoy equality of opportunity and fair treatment without regard to race, color, age, religion, pregnancy, sex, sexual orientation, disability, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, and prior protected activity.


Show more
HTML:
The Foundation

We are the largest nonprofit fighting poverty, disease, and inequity around the world. Founded on a simple premise: people everywhere, regardless of identity or circumstances, should have the chance to live healthy, productive lives. We believe our employees should reflect the rich diversity of the global populations we aim to serve. We provide an exceptional benefits package to employees and their families which include comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage with no premiums, generous paid time off, paid family leave, foundation-paid retirement contribution, regional holidays, and opportunities to engage in several employee communities. As a workplace, we’re committed to creating an environment for you to thrive both personally and professionally.

The Team

In the People function, we are inspired by our mission “All Lives Have Equal Value” and are compelled by the opportunity to make an impact. Along with our partners, we take on complex challenges, continually test new approaches, and embrace change where it will facilitate the best outcome. We are on a mission to evolve how we work by pushing for greater transparency so people have access to information they need to make decisions, creating energy to support a thriving workforce, and showing respect so everyone can bring their best, authentic self to work every day.

Your Role

You are responsible for helping to craft and implement analytics-driven solutions for the foundation’s most pressing human capital priorities. You support the foundation’s organizational and team efficiency work, headcount planning and management, and workforce analytics. You deliver the output of multivariate cross-purpose analyses into useful insights that enable the foundation to improve its processes and decision-making strategies. You craft, build, and maintain HR’s workforce data pipeline and all business intelligence products that leverage workforce data. You will serve as a key partner and consultant to leadership within HR, Operations and with cross-foundation leadership.

What You’ll Do

  • Design, document, implement and maintain business intelligence products in support of cross-functional workforce analytics initiatives including headcount management, operations, HR, and internal communications reporting needs.
  • Partner with analytics, HRIS, and business teams to maintain and improve the data models that feed business intelligence tools and other workforce data and reporting needs across the organization.
  • Develop and maintain scalable data pipelines and build out new API integrations to support ongoing data, analysis and reporting needs.
  • Perform investigation and analysis required to troubleshoot data and system related issues and assists in the resolution of those issues.
  • Use data and analysis methodologies to address business questions or problems and uncover insights that support foundation leaders in making strategic, data-informed decisions.
  • Provide ad hoc data, analysis, and reporting (data visualization) results in support of foundation programs, policies or initiatives. Present resulting analysis, context and key insights to senior leaders.
  • Build technical documents and white papers summarizing analytics research projects, including executive summaries for presentation to senior and executive leadership.
  • Partner with IT and Director of People Data & Technology to develop strategy for long term data platform architecture.
  • Support inclusive culture through modeling behaviors and actions; call out issues in a timely fashion to appropriate partners.


Your Experience

  • A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent proven experience, preferably in quantitative social or physical science, statistics, data analytics, mathematics, or computer science.
  • 5+ years of experience in people analytics or other relevant sector with exposure to people/HR data or other critical data types
  • Familiarity with descriptive and basic inferential statistics to understand usage behaviors and generate and test hypotheses.
  • Intermediate experience and proficiency in a variety of analytical platforms, software languages, and statistical tools: Microsoft Office, data warehouse and management tools (e.g. Azure, SQL, AWS, Redshift), data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau), data preparation and manipulation tools (e.g. MS Fabric, Alteryx, Python, Databricks), enterprise survey platform administration and utilization (e.g. Qualtrics, UKG, Culture Amp, Glint), and multivariate statistical platforms and/or languages (R, SAS, Stata, SPSS).
  • Intermediate experience in people analytics or another relevant sector with exposure to human resources data or other sensitive data types.
  • Experience using appropriate statistical techniques to mitigate bias, interpret statistical significance, and establish sufficient sample size.
  • Experience applying and integrating descriptive and basic predictive analyses to develop strategic and operational insights for human resources and organization-wide decision-making.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with experience distilling and communicating sophisticated data analyses and insights to large and small, technical and non-technical, audiences.
  • Ability to navigate ambiguity, apply prudent judgment, and implement proactively with multiple partners across various levels of the organization.
  • Must be able to legally work in the country where this position is located without visa sponsorship.


The salary range for this role is $127,400 to $191,200 USD. We recognize high-wage market differences in Seattle and Washington D.C., where our offices are located. The range for this role in these locations is $138,900 to $208,300 USD. As a mission-driven organization, we strive to balance competitive pay with our mission. New hires salaries are typically between the range minimum and the salary range midpoint. Actual placement in the range will depend on a candidate’s job-related skills, experience, and expertise, as evaluated during the interview process.

We are dedicated to the belief that all lives have equal value. We strive for a global and cultural workplace that supports ever greater diversity, equity, and inclusion — of voices, ideas, and approaches — and we support this diversity through all our employment practices.

All applicants and employees who are drawn to serve our mission will enjoy equality of opportunity and fair treatment without regard to race, color, age, religion, pregnancy, sex, sexual orientation, disability, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, and prior protected activity.

Title: Operations Associate, Crawler
Description:
At PitchBook, we are always looking forward. We continue to innovate, evolve, and invest in ourselves to bring out the best in everyone. We’re deeply collaborative and thrive on the excitement, energy, and fun that reverberates throughout the company.

Our extensive learning programs and mentorship opportunities help us create a culture of curiosity that pushes us to always find new solutions and better ways of doing things. The combination of a rapidly evolving industry and our high ambitions means there’s going to be some ambiguity along the way, but we excel when we challenge ourselves. We’re willing to take risks, fail fast, and do it all over again in the pursuit of excellence.

If you have a good attitude and are willing to roll up your sleeves to get things done, PitchBook is the place for you.

About the Role:

At PitchBook, we believe that the Data Operations team plays a vital role in setting us apart from our competitors. We take immense pride in providing top-quality data to our customers, while also being accountable, collaborative, and receptive to feedback. Our team members are highly engaged, detail-oriented, and always eager to learn and grow as our industry evolves.

Our reputation for excellence is a direct result of our deep commitment to building the world's best private market database, and we recognize the importance of investing in our team members from day one. That's why we offer specialized training and a mentorship program that is tailored specifically to the needs of the Data Operations team.

We value and celebrate the diverse perspectives, talents, and experiences of our team members and recognize the importance of building trust and strong cross-functional partnerships. If you're looking for a challenging and rewarding opportunity to take your career to new heights, we invite you to join us at PitchBook.

A Data Operations Associate’s primary responsibility is to master our in-house developed Research Tool Suite (RTS), including the PitchBook DocReview Tool (PBDR), and support the high standards of data quality in PitchBook’s datasets. Leading the News Dataset, this role focuses on ensuring the accuracy, efficiency, and scalability of data collection processes while contributing to workflow optimization and innovation.

Primary Job Responsibilities:


Focus on building best-in-class database that provides transparency across Venture Capital, Private Equity, and M&A markets
Lead the development and management of web crawlers that extract high-value data from various online sources, ensuring accuracy, reliability, and efficiency
Leverage our in-house database, business intelligence reports, and other technology-based tools to ensure that proprietary data is audited and added to the PitchBook Platform efficiently while adhering to complex research tracking methodologies to ensure that data is of the utmost quality 
Consistently provide quality customer service and respond to requests from internal and external customers daily  
Provide training and ramping support to new members of the team, both locally and abroad 
Gather team feedback and utilize PowerBI reports to identify root causes of systemic data problems and drive operational, methodology, and RTS Database improvements
Regularly collaborate with Secondary team and the broader Data Operations department to develop and improve processes, tools, and methodologies; identifying opportunities to improve upon the core quality metrics (comprehensiveness, accuracy, timeliness)
Work closely with our Data Operations team in Mumbai to achieve profile production targets. This relationship includes auditing the Mumbai team’s work as well as joining calls to share best practices and process improvement ideas 
Communicate effectively and efficiently with your team and other stakeholders to provide updates on project progress, address roadblocks, and celebrate wins 
Assist senior members of the Data Operations department on the execution of strategic initiatives and achieving operational goals 
Support the vision and values of the company by setting an example and demonstrating desired behaviors
Participate in various company initiatives and projects



Skills and Qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree
1+ years of work experience, including any internship experience
SQL proficiency required
Advanced Excel analysis skills required
Exemplary verbal and written communication skills; comfortable to engage a diverse array of audiences 
Ability to operate with a strong sense of urgency and deliver results 
Self-motivated and goal-oriented attitude and can work effectively as an individual or as part of a team 
Interest in financial markets or services, particularly private equity and venture capital
Analytical and process-oriented with a dedication to continuous improvement 
Ability to problem solve and use judgment to make decisions within ambiguous research situations
Approach each task with an entrepreneurial spirit and intellectual curiosity
Strong organization skills with attention to detail
Proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite including in-depth knowledge of Outlook, Microsoft Word, and Excel with the ability to pick up new systems and software easily  



Benefits + Compensation at PitchBook:

Physical Health


Comprehensive health benefits
Additional medical wellness incentives
STD, LTD, AD&D, and life insurance



Emotional Health


Paid sabbatical program after four years
Paid family and paternity leave
Annual educational stipend
Ability to apply for tuition reimbursement
CFA exam stipend
Robust training programs on industry and soft skills
Employee assistance program
Generous allotment of vacation days, sick days, and volunteer days



Social Health


Matching gifts program
Employee resource groups
Subsidized emergency childcare
Dependent Care FSA
Company-wide events
Employee referral bonus program
Quarterly team building events



Financial Health


401k match
Shared ownership employee stock program
Monthly transportation stipend
Please be aware the above PitchBook benefit and perk offerings are subject to corresponding plan and policy documents and may change during the course of your employment.



Compensation


Annual base salary: $67,000
Target annual bonus percentage: 7.5%
Starting pay will be based on several factors and commensurate with qualifications & experience. We also have a location-based compensation structure; there may be different ranges for candidates by location.



Working Conditions:

We believe our business and our culture are strongest when we work together in person. We also know that it’s helpful to have some flexibility to work remotely. Most roles work in the office 3+ days/week, and some are expected to work in the office 4-5 days/week. The current expectation for this role is that you are working in the office 3+ days/week and that you are in the office full-time during the training period, for which the length varies by role. During an initial phone screen, the team will discuss expectations for this specific position.

The job conditions for this position are in a standard office setting. Employees in this position use PC and phone on an on-going basis throughout the day. Limited corporate travel may be required to remote offices or other business meetings and events.

Life At PB:

We are consistently recognized as a Best Place to Work and our culture is at the heart of our success. It’s our fundamental belief that people do and create great things and that people are the cornerstone of prosperity. We believe that proactively seeking out different points of view, listening to others, learning, and reflecting on what we’ve heard creates a sense of belonging within PitchBook and strengthens the PitchBook community.

We are excited to get to know you and your background. Concerned that you might not meet every requirement? We encourage you to still apply as you might be the right candidate for the role or other roles at PitchBook.

  • Comprehensive health benefits
  • Additional medical wellness incentives
  • STD, LTD, AD&D, and life insurance


Emotional Health

  • Paid sabbatical program after four years
  • Paid family and paternity leave
  • Annual educational stipend
  • Ability to apply for tuition reimbursement
  • CFA exam stipend
  • Robust training programs on industry and soft skills

  • Generous allotment of vacation days, sick days, and volunteer days

Title: Data Analyst, Global Tax Services, Amazon Tax
Description:
Description

Join Amazon’s Tax Team as a Data Analyst for LATAM compliance.

Are you a dynamic Business Analyst with a passion for tax technology? Are you proficient with Data Analysis tools such as SQL? Amazon's Global Tax Services Team is seeking an enthusiastic individual eager to navigate new territories, learn rapidly, and handle confidential information with the utmost integrity.

You're the ideal fit if you possess a blend of data proficiency, solution design skills, and a solid grasp of tax or accounting principles. Your ability to make informed judgments and adapt in a fast-paced environment sets you apart. As a self-starter, you excel in driving initiatives and thrive in a results-driven setting.

Key job responsibilities

In this role, you'll have a diverse range of responsibilities, including:


Design and Delivery: Contribute to the design and implementation of scalable tax technology solutions.
Data Analysis: Conduct in-depth research and analysis of tax reporting data for specific tax jurisdictions, addressing data quality issues, and defining functional requirements for technical development.
Process Improvement: Collaborate with tax teams to enhance efficiency and controller-ship in current processes, educating them on data acquisition for reporting, planning, and controller-ship.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, fostering relationships with the tax, business and engineering teams across Amazon.
Metrics Development: Support the creation of new metrics to quantify the value of various aspects of tax data.


Basic Qualifications


3+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
5+ years of Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau experience
3+ years of business or financial analysis experience
Bachelor's degree or equivalent
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
Experience with SQL
Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in business or financial analysis
Proficiency in written communication and ability to produce high-caliber documentation


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $66,900/year in our lowest geographic market up to $143,100/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2846770

Title: Analyst, Strategic Revenue Management
Description:
Foods you love. Brands you trust. And a career that empowers you to grow.

At Nestlé USA, we’re all working towards the same goal – to delight and deliver for our consumers. With a rich portfolio of beloved brands, including DiGiorno, Toll House, and Coffee mate, in 97% of U.S. households, we have a unique opportunity – and responsibility – to be there for every moment in our consumers’ lives.

Joining Nestlé means becoming part of an inclusive workplace that inspires innovation, encourages strategic thinking and creativity, and celebrates your achievements. No matter where you work within the organization, you are empowered to challenge the status quo, embrace risk-taking, and pioneer new ideas. Our supportive and collaborative environment encourages bold ambitions and continuous learning so that everyone can grow and thrive.

This position is not eligible for Visa Sponsorship.

Nestlé’s Coffee & Beverage Division is on a mission to craft cups that uplift our consumers and better our communities. With brands like Starbucks, Coffee-Mate, Nescafé, Nesquik, Natural Bliss, Seattle’s Best Coffee and Blue Bottle, our diverse product portfolio is brimming with rich and fulfilling opportunities for motivated individuals. Our offices provide an inspiring and high-energy work environment that fuels our fast-paced growth, and our field-based positions across the country ensure that we are fully immersed and positioned to pioneer the coffee and beverage market. Across our organization, we are creating a workplace where collaboration is essential, courage is rewarded, speed is expected, and agility is the norm in order to delight our consumers and shoppers every single day. Together, we will elevate everyday moments with each sip.

Job Summary And Mission

The Strategic Revenue Management (SRM) Analyst will contribute to Coffee & Beverages’ profitability through support of strategic pricing initiatives, insights, implementation, and managing team reporting.

As an SRM Analyst, you will be responsible for ensuring the execution of pricing strategies and the development of pricing insights to drive effective implementation and process integrity. Additional responsibilities include optimizing and executing go-to-market pricing strategies. You will oversee all pricing, spanning pricing terms and trade strategy, price increase review, seasonal and new item launch pricing, price list and playbook management.

The analyst must achieve fluency in databases and systems to perform detailed data analyses and reporting that will help the Pricing team make critical pricing decisions. You will play a crucial role in ensuring accurate and timely reporting of point-of-sales data, metrics, and key insights to support decision-making and drive operational efficiency.

Key Responsibilities


Lead consumer-based pricing strategies in close collaboration with Sales, Category, and Finance teams to create long-term profitable growth.
Drive pricing and trade strategy, support, and monitor implementation, and evaluate performance on an ongoing basis, providing recommendations to improve pricing realization and implementation quality assurance and integrity.
Monitor data and business results for insights of the business, competitors, and brands for early indications of business or market trends, provide proactive, data-backed recommendations to enhance opportunities or mitigate risks as required.
Develop pricing recommendations (proposed prices and overall impact) based on analysis and understanding of implications to category portfolio, sales, finance, operations, supply chain, and overall business objectives.
Present and facilitate discussion on Pricing recommendations to cross functional teams and contribute to Pricing Business Review with Senior Leaders.
Develop and lead the use of IRI, PTA, & TVD tools to analyze historical activity, category trends and industry pricing to make recommendations on pricing and promotional strategies to help drive business unit objectives


Experience And Qualifications


At least 2+ years progressive responsibility in pricing, sales finance, category management or a similar function.
Experience in pricing strategy, finance, or business analysis
Experience with data modeling and syndicated data.
Minimum Bachelor's Degree required. Bachelor’s in mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Economics, or related discipline preferred


Knowledge, Skills And Abilities


Ability to formulate pricing strategies that enhance brand value for customers and connect with the overall strategy of the business. preferred
Solid analytical, quantitative, and financial modelling skills. Must effectively demonstrate ability to utilize data to deliver clear and succinct analysis and articulation of insights that drive towards actionable strategies and decisions.
Ability to translate analytical findings into actionable solutions and processes.
Results-oriented with the ability to initiate and lead projects to completion in a timely manner.
Strong verbal and written communication skills - comfortable communicating the complexities of pricing with across the organization.
Computer skills: MS Windows, including advanced Excel and PowerPoint experience. Basic SQL programming, Visualization Software preferred.


The approximate pay range for this position is $75,000 to $92,000. Please note that the pay range provided is a good faith estimate for the position at the time of posting. Final compensation may vary based on factors including but not limited to knowledge, skills and abilities as well as geographic location.

Nestlé offers performance-based incentives and a competitive total rewards package, which includes a 401k with company match, healthcare coverage and a broad range of other benefits. Incentives and/or benefit packages may vary depending on the position. Learn more at About Us | Nestlé Careers (nestlejobs.com)

Requisition ID: 345541

It is our business imperative to remain a very inclusive workplace.

To our veterans and separated service members, you're at the forefront of our minds as we recruit top talent to join Nestlé. The skills you've gained while serving our country, such as flexibility, agility, and leadership, are much like the skills that will make you successful in this role. In addition, with our commitment to an inclusive work environment, we recognize the exceptional engagement and innovation displayed by individuals with disabilities. Nestlé seeks such skilled and qualified individuals to share our mission where you’ll join a cohort of others who have chosen to call Nestlé home.

The Nestlé Companies are equal employment opportunity employers. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Prior to the next step in the recruiting process, we welcome you to inform us confidentially if you may require any special accommodations in order to participate fully in our recruitment experience. Contact us at accommodations@nestle.com or please dial 711 and provide this number to the operator: 1-800-321-6467.

This position is not eligible for Visa Sponsorship.

Review our applicant privacy notice before applying at https://www.nestlejobs.com/privacy.

HTML:
Foods you love. Brands you trust. And a career that empowers you to grow.

At Nestlé USA, we’re all working towards the same goal – to delight and deliver for our consumers. With a rich portfolio of beloved brands, including DiGiorno, Toll House, and Coffee mate, in 97% of U.S. households, we have a unique opportunity – and responsibility – to be there for every moment in our consumers’ lives.

Joining Nestlé means becoming part of an inclusive workplace that inspires innovation, encourages strategic thinking and creativity, and celebrates your achievements. No matter where you work within the organization, you are empowered to challenge the status quo, embrace risk-taking, and pioneer new ideas. Our supportive and collaborative environment encourages bold ambitions and continuous learning so that everyone can grow and thrive.

This position is not eligible for Visa Sponsorship.

Nestlé’s Coffee & Beverage Division is on a mission to craft cups that uplift our consumers and better our communities. With brands like Starbucks, Coffee-Mate, Nescafé, Nesquik, Natural Bliss, Seattle’s Best Coffee and Blue Bottle, our diverse product portfolio is brimming with rich and fulfilling opportunities for motivated individuals. Our offices provide an inspiring and high-energy work environment that fuels our fast-paced growth, and our field-based positions across the country ensure that we are fully immersed and positioned to pioneer the coffee and beverage market. Across our organization, we are creating a workplace where collaboration is essential, courage is rewarded, speed is expected, and agility is the norm in order to delight our consumers and shoppers every single day. Together, we will elevate everyday moments with each sip.

Job Summary And Mission

The Strategic Revenue Management (SRM) Analyst will contribute to Coffee & Beverages’ profitability through support of strategic pricing initiatives, insights, implementation, and managing team reporting.

As an SRM Analyst, you will be responsible for ensuring the execution of pricing strategies and the development of pricing insights to drive effective implementation and process integrity. Additional responsibilities include optimizing and executing go-to-market pricing strategies. You will oversee all pricing, spanning pricing terms and trade strategy, price increase review, seasonal and new item launch pricing, price list and playbook management.

The analyst must achieve fluency in databases and systems to perform detailed data analyses and reporting that will help the Pricing team make critical pricing decisions. You will play a crucial role in ensuring accurate and timely reporting of point-of-sales data, metrics, and key insights to support decision-making and drive operational efficiency.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead consumer-based pricing strategies in close collaboration with Sales, Category, and Finance teams to create long-term profitable growth.
  • Drive pricing and trade strategy, support, and monitor implementation, and evaluate performance on an ongoing basis, providing recommendations to improve pricing realization and implementation quality assurance and integrity.
  • Monitor data and business results for insights of the business, competitors, and brands for early indications of business or market trends, provide proactive, data-backed recommendations to enhance opportunities or mitigate risks as required.
  • Develop pricing recommendations (proposed prices and overall impact) based on analysis and understanding of implications to category portfolio, sales, finance, operations, supply chain, and overall business objectives.
  • Present and facilitate discussion on Pricing recommendations to cross functional teams and contribute to Pricing Business Review with Senior Leaders.
  • Develop and lead the use of IRI, PTA, & TVD tools to analyze historical activity, category trends and industry pricing to make recommendations on pricing and promotional strategies to help drive business unit objectives

Experience And Qualifications

  • At least 2+ years progressive responsibility in pricing, sales finance, category management or a similar function.
  • Experience in pricing strategy, finance, or business analysis
  • Experience with data modeling and syndicated data.
  • Minimum Bachelor's Degree required. Bachelor’s in mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Economics, or related discipline preferred

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities

  • Ability to formulate pricing strategies that enhance brand value for customers and connect with the overall strategy of the business. preferred
  • Solid analytical, quantitative, and financial modelling skills. Must effectively demonstrate ability to utilize data to deliver clear and succinct analysis and articulation of insights that drive towards actionable strategies and decisions.
  • Ability to translate analytical findings into actionable solutions and processes.
  • Results-oriented with the ability to initiate and lead projects to completion in a timely manner.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills - comfortable communicating the complexities of pricing with across the organization.
  • Computer skills: MS Windows, including advanced Excel and PowerPoint experience. Basic SQL programming, Visualization Software preferred.

The approximate pay range for this position is $75,000 to $92,000. Please note that the pay range provided is a good faith estimate for the position at the time of posting. Final compensation may vary based on factors including but not limited to knowledge, skills and abilities as well as geographic location.

Nestlé offers performance-based incentives and a competitive total rewards package, which includes a 401k with company match, healthcare coverage and a broad range of other benefits. Incentives and/or benefit packages may vary depending on the position. Learn more at About Us | Nestlé Careers (nestlejobs.com)

Title: Business Intelligence and Reporting Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

First Fed is a community bank on an exciting growth trajectory with 18 locations including 12 full-service branches in Western Washington. First Fed was recognized by the Puget Sound Business Journal as a Best Workplace for the last 3 years and a Top Corporate Philanthropist in 2023. By popular vote, First Fed received 2023 awards for Best Bank in The Best of the Northwest, Best Banker in Readers’ Choice by Cascadia Daily News, and Peninsula Daily News named us Best Bank on the Olympic Peninsula. We also received a Best-In-State bank award from Forbes in 2021.

For over 100 years First Fed has served our customers and communities throughout the PNW. We’ve donated over $9 million to non-profit organizations in the past 8 years through our foundations, sponsorships, direct donations, and matched employee donations. Our amazing team has volunteered over 25,000 hours in the past 5 years – many by using our benefit of 3 paid volunteer days per year!

We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – our diversity makes us stronger. Join our award-winning team!

Our Values

Optimism: We are positive and decisive. We believe the future will be better than the past. Our attitude demonstrates persistence which leads to success.

Initiative: We are self-starters and find innovative solutions. We are courageous, entrepreneurial, and passionate. We take action for good.

Respect: We include individuals from diverse backgrounds and with different perspectives. We are committed to honoring and serving others.

Growth: We learn and adapt so we can continually improve. We believe in personal growth through grit and determination.

Ownership: We are invested in our endeavors. We are accountable and take responsibility for our actions and decisions.

Position Purpose

The Business Intelligence and Reporting Analyst plays a key role at First Fed in providing data driven intelligence and insights across all business units through the analysis, design, creation, maintenance, and scheduling of reports, dashboards, and scorecards for all areas of the institution. Creates and maintains a catalogue of queries and reports for audit purposes as well as ensuring consistency between members of the Business Intelligence and Reporting Team.  Maintains process for requesting new reports, dashboards, and scorecards as well as requesting changes to existing reporting.

Essential Functions


Responsible for the analysis, design, and delivery of specialized reports, dashboards, and scorecards to expose multiple data sources to empower critical business decisions to drive growth, value, efficiency, and financial results across the organization.
Maintains expert knowledge of organizational data sources and reporting tools to ensure quality and completeness of BI at an enterprise level.
Performs regular audits to evaluate the quality and integrity of the data across all reporting.
Works across functional areas to understand business drivers, metrics, and KPI’s; and identifies data sources and reporting objectives to develop relevant and timely reporting.
Evaluates, analyzes, and recommends potential for opportunities that enhance business direction and processes.
Performs in-depth tasks and analysis needed to monitor adoption, usage, and performance to drive continuous improvement.
Develops clear and concise data visualizations and written interpretations for communication of results to various management and user groups.
Provides guidance and training to staff in the use of data sources and reporting tools.
Ensures compliance with Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) regulations and other federal and state regulations pertinent to this position. Complete annual BSA training in a timely manner in accordance with BSA regulations and internal policies and procedures.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in data analytics, business intelligence, or computer science or equivalent degree and experience
Typically requires a minimum of five (5) years of relevant experience, including the following:
Advanced knowledge of data mining concepts and approaches.
Experience dealing with complex and large data sets from multiple sources.
Strong analytical skills with the following experience: IBM Cognos, Power BI, Tableau, Azure Data Lake, Azure Databricks, SQL Server, Snowflake and Salesforce is beneficial
Experience with Fiserv Cleartouch (Bank Systems), Prologue, and Business Analytics (Cognos) highly desirable
Excellent communication, issue/problem resolution, presentation, and analytical skills

Physical Requirements:

The work requires the ability to operate office machines and equipment, such as personal computers, printers, copying machines and telephones. The work requires the ability to communicate clearly with customers, coworkers, and others in person and on telephones. Work activities involve a combination of sitting/standing for extended periods.

Pay Range:


The pay range for this position is $26.40 - $44.96 per hour
The typical hiring range for this position is $26.40 - $30.30 per hour
The hiring range may be adjusted accordingly for final candidates in areas with a higher cost of living
The incentive plan for this position is the Support Staff Incentive plan. It is paid out quarterly with a 5% target payout.
Employees will be eligible for our benefits package including medical, dental, and vision insurance, paid time off, retirement plans (401k with company match and Employee Stock Ownership Plan), gym membership reimbursement, discounts on our banking products, and more! Additional information on our benefits package can be viewed at https://www.ourfirstfed.com/careers

  • The typical hiring range for this position is $26.40 - $30.30 per hour

Title: Supply Chain Data Analyst - W2/Hybrid (USC Only)
Description:
Job Title: Supply Chain Data Analyst (Hybrid Position)

Client: T-Mobile

Location: Bellevue, WA (Hybrid - Contract from Day 1)

Contract Duration: 6-9+ months with possible extension

Work Authorization: US Citizens Only

Skills And Experience Required


5+ years of experience as a Supply Chain Data Analyst, with a focus on data analysis and reporting.
SQL proficiency is a must. The candidate should be able to work with large datasets, perform queries, and generate insights.
Strong understanding of inventory management and its interaction with demand and supply.
Ability to quickly learn and utilize PowerBI for creating and updating reports.
Experience running pre-created Python scripts and troubleshooting Python code.
Ability to read and modify Python code to resolve issues and ensure data accuracy.
Experience working with device and accessory demand, inventory data, supply actuals, and forecasting.
Ability to identify and resolve errors causing data inconsistencies.
Skilled in creating both executive-level reports and detailed ad hoc reports.
Proficiency with SQL, Python, PowerBI, and Excel.
Experience in generating regular reports, troubleshooting discrepancies, and gathering data for monthly reporting.
Strong interpersonal skills: effective communication, attention to detail, problem-solving ability, and adaptability.


Ability to collaborate with stakeholders to gather necessary data and provide insights.

Skills: troubleshooting,reporting,powerbi,excel,data consistency,data analysis,sql,supply chain,inventory management,python

Title: Fraud Data Analyst II, Lending
Description:
Job Description

Remitly's vision is to transform lives with trusted financial services that transcend borders. Since 2011, we have been tirelessly delivering on our promises to people who send money around the world. Today, we are reimagining global financial services and building products that extend beyond traditional barriers to give customers access to more of the services they need, no matter where they call home. Join over 2,700 employees worldwide who are growing their careers with purpose and connection with our customers while having a positive impact on millions of people around the globe.

About The Role

The Data Analyst, Fraud (Lending) will be part of Remitly's Identity & Trust Analytics Team. In this role, you will apply data science and analytics techniques to drive rapid, rational decision-making for Remitly's Lending product. You will understand internal fraud systems and customize solutions for Lending. You'll contribute to Lending product development while streamlining the experience for good customers by partnering with program and product managers, engineers, analysts, and designers. This is a hybrid role that requires 2-3 days onsite per week at our Seattle, WA headquarters. This role will report to the the Director of Analytics.

You Will


Become an expert on Remitly's Lending / Fraud data, experience, policy, and regulatory requirements
Build a unified understanding of how our data, customer experiences, and goals align
Create metrics to balance risk vs. reward, performance of systems and operational effectiveness
Collaborate with Lending Product and Business Leaders Compliance to launch new product experiences and continuously improve customer experience
Design experiments, read A/B tests, and perform ad hoc analyses
Formulate hypotheses, design and evaluate product experiments
Generate insights and help define & execute longer term product strategies and roadmaps across multiple product teams


You Have


2+ yrs in an analyst role or similar full-time, professional experience in risk, fraud, fintech, operations,
2+ yrs of experience using SQL for analysis (Python, R, statistical analysis, and modeling a bonus)
Must have experience in any type of adversarial analysis such as risk, fraud, trust & safety
Experience distilling business problems from discussions, developing hypotheses, building an analytical framework, carrying out an analysis, and writing a clear recommendation
Strong data communication skills, including data visualization, technical writing, and business writing
Experience finding creative solutions within the constraints of complex systems and policies
Foundational statistical knowledge
Bachelor's degree in mathematics, engineering, economics, or another quantitative field (or equivalent additional experience)


Compensation Details. The starting base salary range for this position is typically $112,000 -$140,000. In the U.S., Remitly employees are shareholders in our Company and equity is part of our total compensation plan. Your recruiter can share more information about medical benefits offered, as well as other financial benefits and total compensation components offered with this role.

Our Benefits


Flexible paid time off
Health, dental, and vision + 401k plan with company matching
Paid parental, medical, military and family care leave
Mental Health & Family Forming Benefits
Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
Continuing education and travel benefits


We are committed to nondiscrimination across our global organization and in all of our business operations. Employment is determined based upon personal capabilities and qualifications without discrimination on the basis of race, creed, color, religion, sex, gender identification and expression, marital status, military status or status as an honorably discharge/veteran, pregnancy (including a woman's potential to get pregnant, pregnancy-related conditions, and childbearing), sexual orientation, age (40 and over), national origin, ancestry, citizenship or immigration status, physical, mental, or sensory disability (including the use of a trained dog guide or service animal), HIV/AIDS or hepatitis C status, genetic information, status as an actual or perceived victim of domestic violence, sexual assault, or stalking, or any other protected class as established by law.

Remitly is an E-Verify Employer

Remitly is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
