  • Partner with Product squads to identify and validate key opportunities, define KPI targets, and rapidly measure the impact of feature launches.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Marketing and Engineering, to support and align business objectives.
  • Develop reports, visualizations, and dashboards that bring data insights to life for stakeholders.
  • Collect, organize, and analyze large datasets from various sources, focusing on user behavior and business operations.
  • Identify key metrics, track performance against KPIs, and provide clear, actionable recommendations.
  • Ensure data quality and accuracy through regular audits and troubleshooting.
  • Stay ahead of industry trends and best practices in data analytics, tools, and technologies.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field.
  • 2+ years of experience in data analytics or a similar role.
  • Proficiency with SQL and experience working with relational databases.
  • Experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
  • Solid understanding of statistical analysis and A/B testing techniques.
  • Proficiency in Python or R for data analysis and automation.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Master’s degree in a relevant field.
  • 4+ years of experience in data analytics or a similar role.
  • Experience in predictive modeling, search, or recommendation systems.
  • Background in consumer-facing technology or the music industry.
  • Familiarity with cloud-based data environments such as AWS, Google Cloud, or Snowflake.
  • Experience in data visualization best practices applied within Tableau or similar tools

Why Smule?

  • Collaborate with a global team passionate about music and innovation.
  • Work on exciting projects that shape how millions connect and create.
  • Be part of a company that values creativity, curiosity, and impact.
  • Hybrid work model

Ready to turn data into harmony? Apply today and let’s make music together!

Smule is an Equal Opportunity Employer

We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and experiences, and we evaluate all qualified candidates without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process, please contact us

Title: Data Analytics Specialist
Description:
United States, Georgia, Atlanta

Finance

09-Jan-2025

Ref #: 27280

How you'll help us Keep Climbing (overview & key responsibilities)


Design, develop, and optimize reporting and analytics using data models, GRC tools, Power BI and other analytics tools to generate insightful reports and visualizations for executive-level presentations
Understand the needs of the business, prototype data analytics solutions and tools, deploy enhancements, and coordinate with relevant business units to ensure sustainable monitoring solutions
Locate and extract data from internal and external sources for use in reporting, analysis, and statistical modeling
Ensure data accuracy and processes are clearly defined; proactively identify and elevate solutions where inconsistencies may exist
Design and oversee administration of database structures to ensure data integrity controls and establish internal governance processes
Design, implement, and maintain a Key Risk Indicator (KRI) framework
Provide statistical and quantitative analysis for enterprise risk calculations
Assist with monitoring and reporting on key risk indicators, emerging risks, and industry trends in support of Enterprise
Risk Management (ERM) risk assessments and scenario analysis
Assist in researching and documenting business processes, workflows, and user guides for both technical and non-technical audiences and stakeholders
Be intellectually curious, ask questions, and contribute ideas
Enjoy working in a high-profile environment with fluid priorities, ambiguity and aggressive deadlines
Ability to support ~10% international and domestic travel


Benefits and Perks to Help You Keep Climbing

Our culture is rooted in a shared dedication to living our values – Care, Integrity, Resilience, Servant Leadership, and Teamwork – every day, in everything we do. At Delta, our people are our success. At the heart of what we offer is our focus on Sharing Success with Delta employees. Exploring a career at Delta gives you a chance to see the world while earning great compensation and benefits to help you keep climbing along the way.

Why You'll Love Delta


Competitive salary, industry-leading proﬁt sharing program, and performance incentives
401(k) with generous company contributions up to 9%
Paid time off including vacation, holidays, paid personal time, maternity and parental leave
Comprehensive health beneﬁts including medical, dental, vision, short/long term disability and life beneﬁts
Family care assistance through fertility support, surrogacy and adoption assistance, lactation support, subsidized back-up care, and programs that help with loved ones in all stages
Holistic Wellbeing programs to support physical, emotional, social, and financial health, including access to an employee assistance program offering support for you and anyone in your household, free financial coaching, and extensive resources supporting mental health
Domestic and International space-available flight privileges for employees and eligible family members
World-wide partnerships to engage in community service and innovative goals created to focus on sustainability and reducing our carbon footprint
Recognition rewards and awards through the platform Unstoppable Together
Business Resource Groups created to connect employees with common interests to promote inclusion, provide perspective and help implement strategies
Access to over 500 discounts, specialty savings and voluntary benefits through Deltaperks such as car and hotel rentals and auto, home, and pet insurance, legal services, and childcare


What You Need To Succeed (minimum Qualifications)


3+ years experience in Advanced SQL modeling and querying skills
Must have strong mathematical and programming skills
Advanced dashboarding skills using tools like Power BI, Tableau, etc.
Familiarity with Python and using cloud technology (AWS)
Ability to clearly communicate complex data findings to non-technical stakeholders
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify trends and patterns in data
Experience in performing data projects from inception to completion, including timeline and resource management
Ability to work effectively in a team environment and collaborate with other departments
Must be a self-starter with strong attention to detail and ability to work autonomously while managing competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
High ethical standards and integrity, with a commitment to strict confidentiality of sensitive material while promoting a strong risk culture within the organization
Consistently prioritizes safety and security of self, others, and personal data
Embraces diverse people, thinking, and styles
Possesses a high school diploma, GED, or high school equivalency
Is at least 18 years of age and has authorization to work in the United States


What Will Give You a Competitive Edge (preferred Qualifications)


Bachelor’s degree in quantitative disciplines such as Data Science, Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Statistics,
Engineering or 5+ years of equivalent experience in analytics, information science, data visualization, or other relevant quantitative field
Awareness of the following areas of information technology: cloud computing and security, IT governance, Risk Management, IT Infrastructure, Data Privacy and Protection, and Emerging Technologies
Experience with AuditBoard or other related GRC tools

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Farmer’s Fridge is on a mission to make it simple for everyone to eat well. We serve healthy, handcrafted meals and snacks from our growing network of 1700+ Smart Fridges (software-enabled vending machines). We are striving to change the food system from the ground up – one Fridge or delivery at a time.

We are a team that cares -– about the business, the impact our product makes, and each other. We are data-driven, innovative, and quick to move on a good idea. We are looking for people who want to collaborate in an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture and have a passion to succeed.

Farmer’s Fridge is entering a period of rapid growth, and we are looking for a a motivated Data Analyst Intern with strong technical skills and business acumen to help turn millions of potential data points into models and actionable insights that can drive product improvements, make our customer acquisition more efficient, improve our customer retention rates, and drive operating efficiencies on our production and logistics teams.

In a Typical Week/month, You Will


Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using Tableau and Hex
Assist Farmer’s Fridge in FAQ about our data structure
Pull ad-hoc reports via SQL for stakeholders
Assist in SQL and Python code reviews to improve query efficiency and maintainability
Help clean, validate, and organize datasets to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Document data processes and best practices for internal knowledge sharing.


What are we looking for in a Data Analyst intern?


You are creative, flexible, and supremely detail-oriented but never lose sight of the big picture. It would never occur to you to say, “that’s not my job”.
You are comfortable in an environment of high-growth and ambiguity.
You strive for optimization, automation, and continuous improvement, knowing that what is currently being done can always be improved.
You believe learning should be fun and seek to empower each employee at Farmer’s Fridge with the information, benchmarks, metrics, and insights that they need to be independently successful in their roles.


What background are we seeking for a Data Analyst intern?


Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Experience in SQL for querying and manipulating large datasets.
Experience with Python for data analysis and scripting (Pandas, NumPy, etc.).
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.
Familiarity with or willing to learn: version control systems, cloud platforms, and exposure to data warehousing or data pipeline concepts
Understanding of basic analytics engineering concepts (e.g., data modeling, ETL processes).
Strong analytical mindset and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
Detail oriented, organized, and able to effectively communicate
Minimal supervision needed


What You’ll Gain


Hands-on experience in a real-world analytics environment.
Exposure to cutting-edge data tools and methodologies.
Opportunity to collaborate with experienced analysts and engineers.
Potential for future full-time opportunities based on performance.


Farmer’s Fridge Diversity Statement

"Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Farmer’s Fridge, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.”

Farmer’s Fridge is an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity in all employment practices, including hiring, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. View our disclosures related to External Agencies and Applicants below: https://www.farmersfridge.com/careerdisclosures

Title: SQL Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary:

Dexian is seeking a SQL Data Analyst for an opportunity with a client located in Charlotte, NC.



Responsibilities:

Perform testing functions to support the ongoing management and technical enhancements made to the AWARE workflow tool in support of the E2E Know Your Customer (KYC) and Client Due Diligence (CDD) requirements for the entire GBAM business for all sub lines and jurisdictions.
Managing end to end UAT process, execution of test scripts, identifying and documenting defects and providing daily updates to test leads and managers as needed
Works closely with Risk, Compliance, and SMEs to manage and execute test functions
Tests the functionality and usability of new or existing software before it goes live to ensure it is bug-free
Work closely with developers, providing them feedback on what needs improvement to produce top-quality programs that meet stakeholder's expectations
Performs validation testing occurs at the end of a specific change delivery with the primary intent is to ensure the final product matches the stakeholder requirements



Requirements:

4+ years of Data Analysis experience
Heavy SQL querying skills
Financial Services Background






Dexian is a leading provider of staffing, IT, and workforce solutions with over 12,000 employees and 70 locations worldwide. As one of the largest IT staffing companies and the 2nd largest minority-owned staffing company in the U.S., Dexian was formed in 2023 through the merger of DISYS and Signature Consultants. Combining the best elements of its core companies, Dexian's platform connects talent, technology, and organizations to produce game-changing results that help everyone achieve their ambitions and goals.




Dexian's brands include Dexian DISYS, Dexian Signature Consultants, Dexian Government Solutions, Dexian Talent Development and Dexian IT Solutions. Visit https://dexian.com/ to learn more.




Dexian is an Equal Opportunity Employer that recruits and hires qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability, or veteran status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Overview:

The Data Analyst is tasked with collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large sets of data to help drive informed business decisions. You will work with cross-functional teams to turn data into actionable insights, supporting strategic initiatives and operational improvements.




Key Responsibilities:

Data Collection & Management: Gather and manage data from various sources, ensuring its quality and accuracy.
Analysis & Interpretation: Analyze trends, patterns, and anomalies in data sets using statistical techniques.
Reporting & Visualization: Develop reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate findings clearly.
Collaboration: Work with different teams to understand their data needs and provide tailored analytical support.
Tool Utilization: Leverage tools such as SQL, Excel, and BI software (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to perform analyses.
Data Governance: Assist in the development and implementation of data governance best practices.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
2+ years of hands-on experience in data analysis.
Proficiency in data querying and analysis tools (SQL, Excel) and familiarity with data visualization platforms.
Strong analytical skills with an eye for detail.
Excellent communication skills and ability to translate technical findings for non-technical stakeholders.




Benefits:

Competitive salary with performance-based incentives.
Comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, and retirement plans.
Opportunities for continuous learning and professional growth in a data-driven environment.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Pay: Competitive compensation package

Location: Hybrid – Belfast or Central London (EC4N)

The role

We are seeking an ambitious individual with a professional and proactive approach to join our Market Intelligence team.

In collaboration with our consulting team, the Market Intelligence Unit empowers our clients to navigate the market landscape with confidence. We provide insights on both a macro level and through in-depth competitor and market analysis. Your role will involve creating and maintaining innovative data tools that are essential for both internal and external use. You’ll handle large datasets gathered from both online sources and traditional research methods, ensuring their consistency and integrity.

Beyond data management, you’ll have the opportunity to present your findings in impactful ways, making a real difference in our clients’ strategic decisions.

Although the primary focus of this role is data management, we are a growing business. There is potential for advancement within the Market Intelligence Unit, allowing you to assume greater responsibilities over time.

Candidate requirements

Our team has a broad range of backgrounds and interests but everyone is an outperformer, always striving to be the best. They have shown this in their careers to date by doing something exceptional or thinking about things differently.

We do not want robots and we certainly don’t want egos. We are a small team where everyone is expected to support each other. There is no need or tolerance for sharp elbows.

We like people who thrive in uncertainty and see it as an opportunity. We like people who think creatively and commercially, always thinking about how we can enhance our market position. At interview, we like hearing about the knocks people have taken and how they’ve bounced back – because overcoming adversity is a critical skill for a high-growth challenger consultancy with a big vision.

We are looking for candidates with the following qualifications and experience:


A degree from a reputable university
Experience building excel models and managing data
Experience of financial analysis and research
Strong data analysis and data visualisation capabilities – experience in using PowerBI or similar tools ideal
Prior experience within the non-life insurance sector is advantageous but not essential
Willingness to travel to London if based in Belfast
Strong personal and professional motivation


About Oxbow Partners

Oxbow Partners is a rapidly growing specialist management consultancy for the insurance industry, supporting our clients on growth, operations, technology strategy and M&A.

The firm was founded in 2015 to provide a “fresh perspective” to our clients and has since been recognised as one of the top consulting firms in the UK for the insurance industry by the Financial Times since 2021.

Based in London and working internationally, our clients include leaders in the global reinsurance market, established and start-up Lloyd’s and speciality players, UK&I domestic insurers and private equity investors. We have also established ourselves as leading experts on ESG and Gen AI, topics increasingly in focus for insurance executives around the world.

We are very proud to also be a Certified B Corporation, reflecting the ethical way we run our business, including a focus on diversity and inclusion. This makes us unique amongst strategy consulting firms.

Oxbow Partners ambition is to be the most trusted, best informed and most entrepreneurial insurance advisory firm and have more fun delivering than any of our competitors.

To learn more about us, please visit www.oxbowpartners.com.

Why work at Oxbow Partners?

Oxbow Partners combines the best of “big consulting” with the excitement and creativity of a high growth company.


We are a fast-growing firm and you’ll have an exciting ride – as a member of our team you’ll be building a business, not just doing projects
We empower our team members to grow as quickly as they can – there is no hierarchy to keep you in your box
We work on challenging and industry-shaping topics – you’ll quickly find yourself delivering insights to senior leaders at some of the world’s largest institutions
We are a premium brand. Clients know that our people are both world class consultants and experts in our field
We invest heavily in the wellbeing of our teams and have a far better work-life balance than many of our larger competitors


Our Values

Our values guide everything we do and the way we behave at Oxbow Partners:


Strive to be the best, but humble enough to recognise there’s always much to learn
Be hard on facts, even when it means giving tough messages…
…but soft on people
Imperfect impact trumps perfect analysis
Build the brand, and the business will build itself


To apply, please send a CV and covering letter to careers@oxbowpartners.com.
Show more
HTML:
Pay: Competitive compensation package

Location: Hybrid – Belfast or Central London (EC4N)

The role

We are seeking an ambitious individual with a professional and proactive approach to join our Market Intelligence team.

In collaboration with our consulting team, the Market Intelligence Unit empowers our clients to navigate the market landscape with confidence. We provide insights on both a macro level and through in-depth competitor and market analysis. Your role will involve creating and maintaining innovative data tools that are essential for both internal and external use. You’ll handle large datasets gathered from both online sources and traditional research methods, ensuring their consistency and integrity.

Beyond data management, you’ll have the opportunity to present your findings in impactful ways, making a real difference in our clients’ strategic decisions.

Although the primary focus of this role is data management, we are a growing business. There is potential for advancement within the Market Intelligence Unit, allowing you to assume greater responsibilities over time.

Candidate requirements

Our team has a broad range of backgrounds and interests but everyone is an outperformer, always striving to be the best. They have shown this in their careers to date by doing something exceptional or thinking about things differently.

We do not want robots and we certainly don’t want egos. We are a small team where everyone is expected to support each other. There is no need or tolerance for sharp elbows.

We like people who thrive in uncertainty and see it as an opportunity. We like people who think creatively and commercially, always thinking about how we can enhance our market position. At interview, we like hearing about the knocks people have taken and how they’ve bounced back – because overcoming adversity is a critical skill for a high-growth challenger consultancy with a big vision.

We are looking for candidates with the following qualifications and experience:

  • A degree from a reputable university
  • Experience building excel models and managing data
  • Experience of financial analysis and research
  • Strong data analysis and data visualisation capabilities – experience in using PowerBI or similar tools ideal
  • Prior experience within the non-life insurance sector is advantageous but not essential
  • Willingness to travel to London if based in Belfast
  • Strong personal and professional motivation

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
The Business Data Analyst will be responsible for supporting data-driven decision-making across Mirion Medical with a focus on reporting, data management, financial reporting, and master data management. Reporting directly to the S&OP Leader for the Medical Business, this role will collaborate with executives and teams across all four Mirion Medical businesses globally. The Business Analyst will provide critical insights through data analysis and visualization, ensuring data consistency, integrity, and alignment with business goals. This position will also contribute to the financial reporting processes, ensuring alignment with broader business objectives.

Key Areas of Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain reports that provide actionable insights into business performance, supporting both operational and financial decision-making for the Medical Business.
Utilize data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to present complex data and financial reports clearly for business leaders.
Analyze business, operational, and financial data to identify trends, inefficiencies, and opportunities for process improvement across all Mirion Medical businesses.
Work closely with the S&OP Leader for the Medical Business to ensure alignment of reporting and analytics with global business priorities, including financial performance.
Collaborate with executives and key stakeholders across all Mirion Medical businesses to drive consistency and alignment in reporting practices and data analysis.
Design, implement, and automate financial and operational reporting processes to improve efficiency and reduce manual reporting efforts.
Support the maintenance and management of master data, ensuring accuracy and consistency across systems in accordance with best practices.
Monitor and evaluate key performance indicators (KPIs) across both financial and operational metrics, providing insights and recommendations for business improvements.
Contribute to data governance initiatives to maintain high-quality, reliable, and compliant business data.
Assist in continuous improvement efforts for business analytics processes and tools to meet the evolving needs of the business.
Foster strong relationships with global teams to ensure alignment and collaboration across all Mirion Medical business units.

Skills and Experience:

2+ years of experience in business analytics, financial reporting, or data management.
Proficiency in Excel and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Solid understanding of business analytics, financial reporting, and data management principles.
Experience in analyzing financial performance, tracking key financial metrics, and providing financial insights.
Proven ability to collaborate with senior leaders and cross-functional teams to gather reporting requirements, define KPIs, and align reporting with business objectives.
Strong problem-solving skills, with a focus on process efficiency and continuous improvement.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to present complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with CRM tools such as Salesforce.
Detail-oriented with the ability to balance high-level strategic thinking with attention to day-to-day execution.

Academic Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in business, Data Analytics, Finance, or a related field with a strong analytical background.
Previous experience in business analytics or financial reporting within the medical device or healthcare industry is a plus.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

The Data Analyst assists in the preparation, design and execution of models and data products to improve the academic and business outcomes of Stride. The position participates as a member of the analytics team identifying and analyzing school data, proprietary data, and third-party data to answer thoughtful and relevant research questions and provide replicable, well-documented analyses.

SUMMARY: The Data Science Analyst assists in the preparation, design and execution of models and data products to improve the academic and business outcomes of Stride. The position participates as a member of the analytics team identifying and analyzing school data, proprietary data, and third-party data to answer thoughtful and relevant research questions and provide replicable, well-documented analyses.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties.


Leverage products such as: DBT, SQL, Python and GitHub to collect, organize and model data sets for peak functionality per business requirement;
Design, Create, Deploy and Maintain various products and applications through the Power BI service;
Provide ad-hoc analyses to drive insights, provide overviews of major conclusions, constraints or cautions;
Build and manage cross functional relationships in order to synthetize data domain knowledge;
Support initiatives for data integrity and normalization including but not limited to data ownership;
Collaborate with the visualization & modeling teams to ensure cohesiveness between products;
Process confidential data and information according to guidelines;


Supervisory Responsibilities: This position has no formal supervisory responsibilities.

Required Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or related field
Five (5) years of relevant professional experience with BI tools and SQL modeling, including at least three (3) year of experience performing action and outcome-oriented data analysis OR
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases for BI products
OR Equivalent combination of education and experience
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to travel up to 10% of the time
Ability to clear required background check


Certificates and Licenses: None required.

Desired Qualifications


(2+) years modeling with DBT / Snowflake preferred
(3+) years developing BI products (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, etc.)
Experience in K12 education as a teacher, researcher or data personnel


WORK ENVIRONMENT: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


This position is virtual and open to residents of the 50 states and D.C.


Job Type

Regular

The above job is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of duties and standards of the position. Incumbents will follow any other instructions, and perform any other related duties, as assigned by their supervisor. All employment is “at-will” as governed by the law of the state where the employee works. It is further understood that the “at-will” nature of employment is one aspect of employment that cannot be changed except in writing and signed by an authorized officer.

If you are a job seeker with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to apply for one of our jobs, you can request the appropriate accommodation by contacting stridecareers@k12.com.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals With Disabilities

Stride, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants receive consideration for employment based on merit without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state, or local law. Stride, Inc. complies with all legally required affirmative action obligations. Applicants will not be discriminated against because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Location: In-Office | Highpoint – 14100 58th St N, Clearwater, FL 33760

Schedule: Full-time, Monday–Friday |

Exempt/Salaried




Data that drives change. Work that matters.




At Evara Health, we believe that access to quality healthcare should never be limited by circumstance. As a Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC) with 18 locations throughout Pinellas County, we serve more than 75,000 patients annually, offering comprehensive care including Primary Care, Dental, Pediatrics, Behavioral Health, and more.




As we grow, so does our need for strategic, data-driven decision-making. That’s why we’re looking for a Data Analyst who can transform raw numbers into powerful insights that directly impact patient outcomes, organizational strategy, and community health.




If you want to do work that matters—and be part of a mission-driven culture that truly values its people—this is your opportunity.







Why this role matters

As a Data Analyst on the Evara Health team, you’ll build dashboards and reports that directly support clinical outcomes, population health, performance tracking, and grant and regulatory reporting. You’ll work closely with clinical, operational, and executive leaders to turn raw data into meaningful insights—helping drive decisions that improve care for thousands of patients.




If you're an experienced analyst with strong healthcare experience, deep technical skills in SQL and Power BI, and the ability to collaborate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders—you’ll thrive here.







What you’ll do

Build dashboards and dynamic reports: Develop and maintain visualizations using Power BI and SQL across clinical, operational, and financial datasets.
Work with clinical and healthcare data: Extract and analyze EHR (Epic) data to support clinical program performance, grant tracking, and population health management.
Collaborate cross-functionally: Partner with leaders, clinicians, and administrators to understand data needs, present insights, and build tailored solutions that drive action.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity: Conduct data validation, troubleshoot discrepancies, and uphold reporting standards across multiple systems.
Deliver timely and accurate reporting: Produce recurring and ad hoc reports for leadership, grant partners, and external stakeholders that are aligned with regulatory and strategic goals.
Support compliance and risk management: Assist with data for audits, risk reviews, and compliance tracking—ensuring reporting meets federal, state, and internal requirements.







You’re a strong candidate if you...

Have 3–5 years of hands-on experience building dashboards and reports using Power BI and SQL
Have direct experience working with clinical data in a healthcare setting (hospital, health system, FQHC, or provider group strongly preferred)
Have a working knowledge of Epic (or similar EHR platforms)
Understand how to interpret and present data to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Possess strong business acumen and communication skills—you know how to ask the right questions and deliver clear, actionable insights
Are proactive, curious, and detail-oriented, with a passion for solving problems that make a real-world impact
Hold a degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Healthcare Informatics, or a related field; data analytics certifications (e.g., Power BI, Google, Tableau) are a plus







Total Rewards That Go Beyond the Basics

At Evara Health, we believe great people make great organizations. That’s why we offer one of the most generous and unique benefits packages in our industry:

36 days of paid time off to start (25 PTO, 10 holidays, 1 birthday)
Quarterly performance-based bonus payouts
4% employer contributions to your retirement—no match required
90% employer-paid healthcare premiums
Up to $1,000/year in HSA contributions
Free or discounted healthcare at Evara Health facilities
Free gym memberships and public transportation access (PTSA)
$1,500/year in education assistance for certifications, training, or formal education
A mission-driven workplace with record-breaking engagement scores and a supportive, innovative culture







Ready to turn healthcare data into life-changing outcomes?




At Evara Health, this isn’t just a data role. It’s a chance to work with purpose—translating insights into action, and action into impact.




Apply today and join a team driven by purpose and powered by people.

Show more

Ready to turn healthcare data into life-changing outcomes?


At Evara Health, this isn’t just a data role. It’s a chance to work with purpose—translating insights into action, and action into impact.


Apply today and join a team driven by purpose and powered by people.

Title: Data Analyst I
Description:
The Data Solutions Analyst supports data initiatives through the delivery of data pipelines, reports, and dashboards. They ensure data sourced for pipelines, reports, and dashboards they deliver are from quality data sources while also supporting data preparation requirements for analytics team members. The Data Solutions Analyst serves as a front-line data user that supports manual and automated data quality processes to ensure company data is maintained at a high quality. Through this function, the Data Solutions Analyst also recommends methodologies to improve data quality and analytical preparation processes. Additionally, they serve as a source for business requirements for strategic data initiatives.

Position Responsibilities

Reporting


Deliver ad hoc reports and dashboards based on documented business requirements. Maintain data and visualization capabilities of developed data assets to ensure quality and support reuse.
Support reporting capabilities as a part of a delivery team executing consultative insights and analysis to business decisionmakers.
Perform routine quality checks on existing data assets to ensure integrity and support issue troubleshooting and remediation.
Provide subject matter expertise and requirements on long-term data strategy efforts designed to harden ad hoc reports and dashboards.


Data Wrangling


Manipulate and integrate data from existing data products, pipelines, and reports to support data value delivery.
Perform ad hoc data quality checks and manual fixes on pipeline data to support data quality management and issue remediation processes.
Integrate data from various sources to support documented business requirements.
Comply with information lifecycle management and data governance policies, standards, and guidelines.


Decision Science


Support Lead Analysts and Information Architects by provisioning data from non-standard sources as needed.
Collaborate with team members on business intelligence and visualization requirements to support insight delivery efforts.
With direction, delivers insights/analysis on business performance based on KPIs and metrics to support broader analytical initiatives.
With supervision, support business insight delivery on internal consulting projects of moderate complexity.


Position Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, or other relevant technology degrees or a High School Diploma or GED with 6 years of progressively responsible experience
2 years of Technology experience and proficiency
1 year of experience in data structures and data modeling
1 year of experience in data visualization techniques experience (Power BI, Tableau)
This position is not eligible for sponsorship. Must have indefinite employment authorization.


Preferred Qualifications


1 year of experience documenting and assisting product owners with creating system/business requirements
1 year of experience with Microsoft Office and expanded product lines (Visio, MS Project, SharePoint)
1 year of experience in banking or related industries Experience in data profiling, statistical analysis, data analysis, and data standardization / cleansing techniques
Strong SQL skills with the ability to write sophisticated queriers across large, complex data sets
Experience using statistical techniques to discover the root cause of data quality issues and recommend remediation options
Ability to analyze data trends, identify patterns and proactively address potential data quality issues
Experience with Collibra, Informatica, and Snowflake (Python, R is a plus)
This position is not eligible for sponsorship. Must have indefinite employment authorization.


Work Best Category

Category C - Days in the office will either be designated days or will vary week to week from 2-5 days

Hours

8:00am - 5:00pm Monday - Friday

Salary

To Be Determined Based on Individual Experience

About Comerica

We know our employees are critical to our overall success and we are dedicated to investing in their future. One of the ways we do this is to offer a comprehensive Total Rewards package designed to recognize and reward individual performance, as well support health, well-being, development and security for our colleagues and their family. Total Rewards consists of cash compensation, development and flexible benefit programs designed to meet individual needs today and in the future. Your salary will be commensurate with your work experience and our programs are reviewed regularly to ensure each remain competitive. We are proud to offer benefits such as health and welfare programs, strong retirement benefits, and generous paid time off programs. You and your eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children, can participate in medical, dental, and vision benefits, 401(k) and pension, income protection benefits such as life insurance, AD&D, and supplemental health programs to offset unexpected health care expenses. We also have a variety of time off programs for things like vacation, sick time, disability, and parental leave. Eligibility for some programs varies based on employment status and tenure.

Upon offer, Comerica conducts a comprehensive background and fingerprint check.

NMLS certification requirement: where applicable, a favorable background check screening, credit check, fingerprint check, and NMLS certification is required in accordance with the SAFE Act.

Comerica Incorporated (NYSE: CMA) is a financial services company headquartered in Dallas, Texas, and strategically aligned into three major business segments; the Commercial Bank, the Retail Bank, and Wealth Management. Comerica's colleagues focus on relationships, and helping people and businesses be successful. In addition to Texas, Comerica Bank locations can be found in Arizona, California, Florida and Michigan, with select businesses operating in several other states, as well as in Canada and Mexico.

Comerica is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer - veterans/individuals with disabilities, committed to workplace diversity.

Position Responsibilities

Reporting

  • Deliver ad hoc reports and dashboards based on documented business requirements. Maintain data and visualization capabilities of developed data assets to ensure quality and support reuse.
  • Support reporting capabilities as a part of a delivery team executing consultative insights and analysis to business decisionmakers.
  • Perform routine quality checks on existing data assets to ensure integrity and support issue troubleshooting and remediation.
  • Provide subject matter expertise and requirements on long-term data strategy efforts designed to harden ad hoc reports and dashboards.

Data Wrangling

  • Manipulate and integrate data from existing data products, pipelines, and reports to support data value delivery.
  • Perform ad hoc data quality checks and manual fixes on pipeline data to support data quality management and issue remediation processes.
  • Integrate data from various sources to support documented business requirements.
  • Comply with information lifecycle management and data governance policies, standards, and guidelines.

Decision Science

  • Support Lead Analysts and Information Architects by provisioning data from non-standard sources as needed.
  • Collaborate with team members on business intelligence and visualization requirements to support insight delivery efforts.
  • With direction, delivers insights/analysis on business performance based on KPIs and metrics to support broader analytical initiatives.
  • With supervision, support business insight delivery on internal consulting projects of moderate complexity.

Position Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, or other relevant technology degrees or a High School Diploma or GED with 6 years of progressively responsible experience
  • 2 years of Technology experience and proficiency
  • 1 year of experience in data structures and data modeling
  • 1 year of experience in data visualization techniques experience (Power BI, Tableau)
  • This position is not eligible for sponsorship. Must have indefinite employment authorization.

Preferred Qualifications

  • 1 year of experience documenting and assisting product owners with creating system/business requirements
  • 1 year of experience with Microsoft Office and expanded product lines (Visio, MS Project, SharePoint)
  • 1 year of experience in banking or related industries Experience in data profiling, statistical analysis, data analysis, and data standardization / cleansing techniques
  • Strong SQL skills with the ability to write sophisticated queriers across large, complex data sets
  • Experience using statistical techniques to discover the root cause of data quality issues and recommend remediation options
  • Ability to analyze data trends, identify patterns and proactively address potential data quality issues
  • Experience with Collibra, Informatica, and Snowflake (Python, R is a plus)
  • This position is not eligible for sponsorship. Must have indefinite employment authorization.

Work Best Category

Category C - Days in the office will either be designated days or will vary week to week from 2-5 days

Hours

8:00am - 5:00pm Monday - Friday

Salary

To Be Determined Based on Individual Experience

About Comerica

We know our employees are critical to our overall success and we are dedicated to investing in their future. One of the ways we do this is to offer a comprehensive Total Rewards package designed to recognize and reward individual performance, as well support health, well-being, development and security for our colleagues and their family. Total Rewards consists of cash compensation, development and flexible benefit programs designed to meet individual needs today and in the future. Your salary will be commensurate with your work experience and our programs are reviewed regularly to ensure each remain competitive. We are proud to offer benefits such as health and welfare programs, strong retirement benefits, and generous paid time off programs. You and your eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children, can participate in medical, dental, and vision benefits, 401(k) and pension, income protection benefits such as life insurance, AD&D, and supplemental health programs to offset unexpected health care expenses. We also have a variety of time off programs for things like vacation, sick time, disability, and parental leave. Eligibility for some programs varies based on employment status and tenure.

Upon offer, Comerica conducts a comprehensive background and fingerprint check.

NMLS certification requirement: where applicable, a favorable background check screening, credit check, fingerprint check, and NMLS certification is required in accordance with the SAFE Act.

Comerica Incorporated (NYSE: CMA) is a financial services company headquartered in Dallas, Texas, and strategically aligned into three major business segments; the Commercial Bank, the Retail Bank, and Wealth Management. Comerica's colleagues focus on relationships, and helping people and businesses be successful. In addition to Texas, Comerica Bank locations can be found in Arizona, California, Florida and Michigan, with select businesses operating in several other states, as well as in Canada and Mexico.

Comerica is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer - veterans/individuals with disabilities, committed to workplace diversity.

Title: Reporting Analyst
Description:
TRADER Corporation is a trusted Canadian leader in online media, dealer and lender services. The company is comprised of AutoTrader.ca, AutoSync and Dealertrack Canada. AutoTrader.ca (AutoHebdo.net in Quebec) offers the largest inventory of new cars and used cars in Canada, receiving over 25 million monthly visits to its marketplace. With over 3,500 subscribers and counting, AutoSync is the largest and fastest growing dealer and OEM software provider in Canada. The platform's suite of connected automotive software solutions brings advertising, conversion and operational support together, synchronizing the entire retail process. AutoSync's diverse range of offerings includes: vAuto, EasyDeal, xtime, Motoinsight, Activix, TAdvantage and TRFFK. Dealertrack is Canada’s largest automotive financing portal, enhancing efficiency and profitability for all major segments of the automotive, marine, recreational vehicle, motorcycle and powersport retail industries. Over 6.5 million credit applications are submitted via the Dealertrack Canada portal each year. Collateral Management is a national, end-to-end, managed technology solution that offers industry insight and multi-channel collection strategies to maximize funds recovered. Collateral Management helps you remain compliant in all jurisdictions, alleviating your exposure to reputational and financial risks. Visit tradercorporation.com to learn more. .




TRADER Corporation's parent company AutoScout24 is the largest pan-European online car market with over 2 million listings and more than 43,000 dealer customers. With AutoScout24, users can find, finance, buy, subscribe for and sell used and new cars. The marketplace provides inspiration on cars and other vehicles and makes hard decisions easy.




Since 1998 AutoScout24 has been offering private users, car dealers and other cooperation partners from the automotive, financial and insurance services sector a comprehensive digital platform for car trading. The online marketplace includes used and new cars, motorcycles as well as commercial vehicles. AutoScout24 has over 30 million users per month, more than 43,000 dealers and around 500 employees. In addition to Germany, AutoScout24 is also represented in the European core markets of Belgium, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Italy, France and Austria.




More information on www.autoscout24.de




Experience leveraging AI, Generative AI (GenAI) to enhance engineering productivity, automate repetitive tasks, and optimize workflows. Candidates should demonstrate the ability to integrate AI-driven solutions into their daily work — such as code generation, debugging, reviews, documentation, and decision support—to improve efficiency for themselves and their teams. A proactive approach to exploring and implementing AI tools that drive innovation and streamline development processes is highly valued




The Reporting Analyst is responsible for the design, development, and maintenance of reports and dashboards, assisting with the analysis and reporting of business data across various departments. This role will focus on data analysis, reporting automation, and delivering actionable insights to support decision-making and performance improvement. The position is responsible for analyzing and reporting on performance to improve results and facilitate future goal setting as well as reviewing current processes to improve efficiency, quality, and accuracy.Proficiency in Power BI is required, and experience with SQL is preferred, as the role involves working with large datasets and optimizing data retrieval. The position also requires expertise in Excel, data visualization tools, and an understanding of business data from CRMs like Salesforce, as well as the ability to produce polished reports that provide valuable business insights.

Key Responsibilities:

- Data Analysis & Reporting

Responsible for gathering, analyzing, and reporting on key business data to provide insights that drive strategic decisions. This includes data cleaning, trend identification, and performance analysis across various departments and business functions.

- Report Development & Maintenance

Design, develop, and maintain routine and ad-hoc reports for business leaders and teams. Ensure reports are clear, accurate, and aligned with business objectives. Provide actionable insights through Excel, Power BI, Tableau, or other data visualization tools.

- Dashboard & Data Visualization

Build and maintain interactive dashboards to provide real-time business data insights through CRM reporting or Data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, etc. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand reporting needs and deliver tailored dashboards to track business performance.

- Process Improvement & Automation

Identify opportunities for automating reporting processes and improving data accuracy and efficiency. Develop automated reporting systems that reduce manual efforts and improve data accessibility.

- Performance Analysis & Reporting

Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics across business units. Provide regular updates on performance, highlight trends, and identify areas for improvement. Use advanced Excel functions, SQL queries, and other tools to analyze large datasets and draw actionable conclusions.

- Collaboration & Support

Work closely with cross-functional teams (e.g., IT, Finance, Marketing) to gather data requirements and deliver reports that align with business needs. Provide training and support to team members on report interpretation and usage.

- Ad-hoc Reporting & Projects

Manage ad-hoc reporting and analytical projects as needed by the business. Collaborate with other departments to ensure data analysis supports project objectives and problem resolution. Provide insights that drive process improvement and strategic decision-making.

Job Requirements




Please indicate if required (R), preferred (P) or asset (A)

- Bachelor’s degree in Business, Data Science, Economics, or a related field (R)

- Minimum 2-5 years of experience in a reporting or data analyst role (R)

- Strong analytical and computer skills with proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, vlookups, macros, other formulas) and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI) (R)

- Experience with SQL or other data querying languages (P)

- Experience with CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce) is an asset (P)

- Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud) is desirable (P)

- Experience with programming languages (e.g., Python or R) is a plus (A)

- Strong communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to present complex data in an understandable format

- Ability to prioritize tasks, manage deadlines, and work in a fast-paced environment

- Ability to work with minimal supervision and collaborate across teams

- Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills

- Demonstrated ability to analyze data and provide actionable insights




What’s in it for you…

-We understand that there is life at work and life outside of work. Here are a few benefits we all benefit from that support us to be our creative best.

Fitness and wellness

-We provide discounts to nation-wide gyms, onsite gyms (when we’re in the office), an Employee and Family Assistance Program, as well as a virtual wellness program.

Benefits from Day 1

-Gym discounts

-Local in-office free gyms

-Employee and Family Assistance program

-Weekly virtual wellness events

-Conferences & training budget

-Regular internal training programs

Financial planning

-Let us help you invest in your future with 3% matching towards your pension and multiple forms of income protection.

Competitive salary

-Annual bonus structure

-3% CPP matching

Title: Sustainability Data Analyst
Description:
Our client, a specialist real estate consulting firm, is taking an innovative and disruptive approach to structuring property development deals. They are seeking a Sustainability Data Analyst to support data administrative tasks for a large, complex project with a US-based client.




Responsibilities:

Identify and autonomously reach out to global stakeholders to gather essential sustainability data.
Perform thematic analysis of findings, drawing actionable insights before aggregating data.
Assist in the creation and management of an initiative tracking tool for business use.
Handle data-heavy administrative tasks to ensure smooth project operations.




Requirements:

1-2 years of experience in data analysis.
Bachelor's degree in quantitative field
Proven experience with data-heavy administrative tasks.
Strong communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights.
Proactive, go-getter, with interest in sustainability




Details:

Start date: ASAP
Location: US-based (remote possible, close to EDT or PDT time zones)
Salary: $60,000 - $80,000 pro-rated Fixed Term Contract
Duration: 6 months

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Required Skills & Experience

- 0-2 years of data analysis

- Degree in Computer Science (preferably within a data centric area)

- SQL

- Python

- Great communication and presentation skills




Nice to Have Skills & Experience

- Tableau

- DataBricks

- Call center background




Job Description

- Our client is looking to build a team of Data Scientists to support real-time transcription of their high-volume contact centers based virtually and throughout the United States.

- The team currently has Speech Analysts, and they are looking to expand their capabilities to provide real-time text data transcription and sentiment analysis, and use AI instead of audio.

- The goal is to develop AI models with transcripts to capture call summaries in two to three sentences about the issue and resolution, and gather sentiment feedback based on tone, energy, and language.

- Currently, they have natural language processing (NLP) in place and need to improve LLMs for GenAI. They’re not wanting the creation of a chatbot or repository, but more so candidates who understand what is going on behind the screen and fine tuning the existing model.

- The LLMs are text data specific and they need to incorporate more word embedding to convert word phrases to numerical representation of words using different techniques to identify similarities and allow the computer to understand those meanings.

- The goal is to build their own ChatGPT which will involve transcript and phonetic based queries converting that to transcript-based queries.




- This role will be responsible for:

o Performs data collection, analysis, validation and reporting.

o Designs, tests, and documents processes, SQL queries, and stored procedures.

o Support some manual labeling of data

o Build out dashboards

o Extracts and analyzes data from various sources, including databases, manual files, and external websites.

o Responds to data inquiries from various groups within an organization.

o Creates and publishes regularly scheduled and ad hoc reports.

The pay rate for this role varies depending on level and years of experience and will range from $25-$32/hour.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
3 Openings (Data Engineer, Data Scientist, Data Analyst)

Location: Hybrid (2-3 days a week onsite), Denver CO

Pay Rate: $70 - $80 /hr. on W2 with benefits

Contract: Long Term Contract (possibility of conversion to an FTE)




Responsibilities

Create and maintain dashboards to provide insights for the data team.
Conduct high-level data analysis to identify trends and anomalies.
Answer stakeholder questions about dashboards and models.
Support business intelligence efforts through analytical reporting.
Assist in model interpretation and prioritization for network improvements.
Work on impairment scoring and developing prioritization frameworks for node groups.

Required Qualifications

Proficiency in SQL and Python for data analysis.
Strong dashboarding experience (Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Data science knowledge to support high-level decision-making.
Ability to slice and dice data to extract meaningful insights.
Strong communication skills for presenting data-driven recommendations.

Preferred Qualifications

Familiarity with cloud data environments (AWS, Snowflake, BigQuery).
Experience in network analytics and outage management tools.
Prior work in feature importance analysis and ML interpretation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Overview 

We're looking for a Data Analyst with exceptional data mining, extraction, and modeling experience with a keen business acumen.  The successful candidate will work with a combination of financial and operational data. This role will be responsible for template and automation creation, status reporting, and database / Smartsheet configuration.  This role will work to validate, organize, and analyze data to generate insights. This role is located in Denver, CO. All qualified candidates MUST reside in the Denver metropolitan area and be able to work on-site. In addition, all qualified candidates MUST be authorized to work in the United States without requiring sponsorship or C2C.

 

Duties & Responsibilities 

Creating templates and automation, status reporting, and configuration
Building of scalable, flexible, and detailed data models 
Conducting ad-hoc analyses and presenting results in a clear and insightful manner 
Creating meaningful data visualizations and compelling data views 
Familiarity working in large, enterprise environment with many cross functional teams 
Communicating with stakeholders in a professional, succinct and helpful manner 
Detail-oriented, well-organized, and an ability to work independently  
Ability to flex and be adaptable between different data requests and collaborating teams



Requirements


Minimum of 5 years direct experience in data analytics, data modeling, or data reporting 
Experience in the telecommunications/broadband industry is preferred
Proficient in using Advanced Excel (including Power Pivot and VBA)  
Proficiency in SQL; familiarity with SQL database structures, access, and modification  
Proficient with SmartSheet and Tableau is desired 
Excellent query and scripting skills 
Familiarity working with multiple data sources including financial and operational data 
Ability to work with data visualization tools and techniques and to translate information into compelling data views is required
Exceptional ability to communicate with stakeholders and provide insightful and meaningful data interpretations



Education/Certifications 

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related degree is required 

 


Compensation

For individuals assigned and/or hired to work in Colorado, Sand Cherry Associates is required by law to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. This compensation range is specific to the State of Colorado and takes into account a wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and delivery model. This role is a 6+ month contract has an hourly rate range of $60 - $70. Years of experience, level of education, geographic location, unique skills/qualifications for the specific role and potential certifications can be key factors in the final compensation for this role. Our benefits package includes health and financial benefits such as medical, dental, vision, 401k and PTO.




Benefits



Our team is unique — we are passionate about what we do. At Sand Cherry, our Consultants know they are impacting and shaping our clients' industries. We recognize our employees for their contributions. Our culture is one of the most friendly and communicative in the consulting industry. Sand Cherry is not a top-heavy organization. We offer the opportunity to be part of a digital workforce. Discover the experience that only comes with self-responsibility in the workplace. Our team members manage their own workloads and are expected to deliver exceptional work for our clients. Professional career growth is one of our main priorities, as we affirm that investing in our Consultants and empowering our people will also deliver the best results and value for our clients.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
LHH Recruitment Solutions is seeking a talented Data Analyst to join a team in Greater Sacramento. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis to drive insights and support decision-making processes. If you have a strong background in data science, statistics, or computer science, and are eager to work in a collaborative setting, we want to hear from you!




**Employer is not able to support in visa transfer or sponsorship at this time.**




Responsibilities:




Analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights and support business decisions.
Develop and maintain data visualization dashboards using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Google Data Studio.
Perform data integration, cleaning, and transformation (ETL processes) to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Generate reports and present data findings to non-technical stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and provide analytical support.
Utilize data analysis tools such as Excel, R, Python, and SQL to perform complex analyses.
Ensure data privacy and compliance with relevant regulations.




Qualifications:




Bachelor's Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field; or an Associate's Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or Information Systems with 2 years of experience in a related field.
2-4 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in a non-profit or similar sector.
2+ years of expertise in data analysis tools such as Excel, R, Python, and SQL.
Proficiency in data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Google Data Studio.
2+ years of experience in data integration, cleaning, and transformation (ETL processes).
Familiarity with CRM or fundraising platforms (e.g., Salesforce, ADP) is a plus.
Familiarity with cloud-based data storage and analysis solutions (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud) is a plus.







Salary Range & Work Modality:




Salary Range: $80,000 - $94,000
Work Modality: Hybrid position based in Greater Sacramento, CA. Expect to work more on-site during the initial onboarding period. Flexible work schedule options available after onboarding.
standard medical, dental, vision, and retirement plan

Title: Data & Analytics Specialist
Description:
Responsibilities
About the Team
The Data & Analytics team aims to use data as powerful language to translate business goals and evaluate business achievement. The team's general mission is to partner with cross functional stakeholders from a data perspective and provide best-in-class analytics and elite internal operational tool support. It includes 3 parts: Central D&A, Regional D&A, Data Operation team.

About the Role
In this role, you will provide best-in-class analytics, create unified measurement frameworks, and develop operational tools to evaluate and optimize Content Ops’ contribution to TikTok’s business.

Responsibilities
The Data & Analytics team aims to use data as powerful language to translate business goals and evaluate business achievement.
- Provide a general measurement framework to evaluate Content Ops contribution with internal Content Ops team and Product and Algo team.
- Create elite one stop data tool with unified metrics definition for Content Ops team daily operation efficiency improvement.
- Provide best-in class analytics and ecosystem insights for the Content organization.
- Optimize/scope internal operational tools to improve efficiency in the areas reflected by general measurement framework.

As for Data & Analytics - Publisher team members, the main goals are to:
- Develop and optimize data solutions to enhance operational efficiency and decision-making.
- Design and implement measurement frameworks to track performance and support strategic initiatives.
- Conduct in-depth analysis to uncover insights that drive content, creator, and business growth.
- Collaborate cross-functionally with internal teams to ensure alignment of data strategies and methodologies.
- Support central pillars by providing market insights and adapting measurement frameworks to diverse needs.
- Continuously improve internal processes by identifying automation opportunities and reducing manual data work.

Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications
- Bachelor’s degree or above, with 3+ years of experience in Data Analysis or a related field.
- Strong analytical skills in business metric evaluation, pattern recognition, and problem-solving to drive strategic decision-making.
- Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools, with a solid understanding of data warehousing and pipeline structures.
- Goal-oriented, adaptable, and capable of effectively collaborating across functions (XFN).

Preferred Qualifications
- Experience in the internet industry, particularly social media platforms.
- Background in statistics, mathematics, business analysis, or a related field.
- Experience working in global markets and analyzing content ecosystems across different regions.
- Hands-on experience with Python and data modeling is a plus.

About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.​


Why Join Us
Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect – and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.​
We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.​
​
Diversity & Inclusion​
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.​


TikTok Accommodation
TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, sincerely held religious beliefs or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at https://tinyurl.com/RA-request​


Job Information
【For Pay Transparency】Compensation Description (Annually)
The base salary range for this position in the selected city is $150000 - $190000 annually.​
Compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and experience, and location. Base pay is one part of the Total Package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work, and this role may be eligible for additional discretionary bonuses/incentives, and restricted stock units.​
Benefits may vary depending on the nature of employment and the country work location. Employees have day one access to medical, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) savings plan with company match, paid parental leave, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, wellbeing benefits, among others. Employees also receive 10 paid holidays per year, 10 paid sick days per year and 17 days of Paid Personal Time (prorated upon hire with increasing accruals by tenure).​
The Company reserves the right to modify or change these benefits programs at any time, with or without notice.​
For Los Angeles County (unincorporated) Candidates:​
Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state, and local laws including the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act. Our company believes that criminal history may have a direct, adverse and negative relationship on the following job duties, potentially resulting in the withdrawal of the conditional offer of employment:​
1. Interacting and occasionally having unsupervised contact with internal/external clients and/or colleagues;​
2. Appropriately handling and managing confidential information including proprietary and trade secret information and access to information technology systems; and​
3. Exercising sound judgment.​

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Únete a nuestro equipo y contribuye en mejorar el futuro de las personas

#AllianzMexico #LetsCareForTomorrow #TeamAllianz




Solicitamos: ANALISTA DE DATOS




Acerca de la empresa:

El Grupo Allianz es una multinacional alemana de servicios financieros con sede en Múnich. Es uno de los grupos aseguradores y proveedores de servicios financieros más importantes del mundo.




Principales responsabilidades del puesto:

Desarrollar y analizar cifras y KPIs de acuerdo con las necesidades de la línea de negocio para generar estrategias de crecimiento rentable.
Construcción de información histórica de todos los ramos mediante consultas en R y VBA.
Elaboración de tableros y dashboards.




Requisitos para el puesto:

Lic. en Económico-administrativa, Finanzas, Actuaría o afín (concluida)
Experiencia mínima de 3 años en generación de Dashboards en Power BI.
Programación en R
Experiencia en seguros de Daños
Manejo de R, Power BI, VBA, Office
Inglés nivel intermedio




Prestaciones y beneficios adicionales:

Sueldo base competitivo
Bono anual por resultados
Vacaciones superiores a las de la ley
Fondo de ahorro y caja de ahorro
Seguro de Gastos Médicos Mayores
Seguro de Vida
Vales de despensa y restaurante
Buen ambiente laboral
Horario flexible e híbrido con 2 días de HO a la semana, entre otros.




En Allianz el bienestar de nuestros colaboradores es muy importante por lo que no solo ofrecemos herramientas que los apoyan en su desarrollo profesional y personal.




Plataforma Degreed (cursos en línea) abierta para todos los colaboradores
Aplicación MiDocOnline a través de la cual los colaboradores pueden consultar médicos generales, psicólogos y nutriólogos de manera gratuita
Diferentes eventos deportivos y de integración.




Interesados postularse por este medio.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Overview:

The Data Analyst is tasked with collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large sets of data to help drive informed business decisions. You will work with cross-functional teams to turn data into actionable insights, supporting strategic initiatives and operational improvements.




Key Responsibilities:

Data Collection & Management: Gather and manage data from various sources, ensuring its quality and accuracy.
Analysis & Interpretation: Analyze trends, patterns, and anomalies in data sets using statistical techniques.
Reporting & Visualization: Develop reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate findings clearly.
Collaboration: Work with different teams to understand their data needs and provide tailored analytical support.
Tool Utilization: Leverage tools such as SQL, Excel, and BI software (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to perform analyses.
Data Governance: Assist in the development and implementation of data governance best practices.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
2+ years of hands-on experience in data analysis.
Proficiency in data querying and analysis tools (SQL, Excel) and familiarity with data visualization platforms.
Strong analytical skills with an eye for detail.
Excellent communication skills and ability to translate technical findings for non-technical stakeholders.




Benefits:

Competitive salary with performance-based incentives.
Comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, and retirement plans.
Opportunities for continuous learning and professional growth in a data-driven environment.

Title: Jr.Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Jr. Data Analyst to join their team on a freelance basis. In this role, you will assist in analyzing healthcare data to support decision-making processes and improve patient care outcomes. You will collaborate with senior analysts and various departments to gather, clean, and interpret data, ensuring accuracy and relevance in reporting.




Your responsibilities will include compiling reports, identifying trends, and providing insights based on data analysis. You will also be involved in data visualization efforts to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills, proficiency in data analysis tools, and a passion for leveraging data to drive improvements in the healthcare sector.







Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Experience with data analysis software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, R).
Experience with Oracle Fusion
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks effectively.
