Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Pay: Competitive compensation package

Location: Hybrid – Belfast or Central London (EC4N)

The role

We are seeking an ambitious individual with a professional and proactive approach to join our Market Intelligence team.

In collaboration with our consulting team, the Market Intelligence Unit empowers our clients to navigate the market landscape with confidence. We provide insights on both a macro level and through in-depth competitor and market analysis. Your role will involve creating and maintaining innovative data tools that are essential for both internal and external use. You’ll handle large datasets gathered from both online sources and traditional research methods, ensuring their consistency and integrity.

Beyond data management, you’ll have the opportunity to present your findings in impactful ways, making a real difference in our clients’ strategic decisions.

Although the primary focus of this role is data management, we are a growing business. There is potential for advancement within the Market Intelligence Unit, allowing you to assume greater responsibilities over time.

Candidate requirements

Our team has a broad range of backgrounds and interests but everyone is an outperformer, always striving to be the best. They have shown this in their careers to date by doing something exceptional or thinking about things differently.

We do not want robots and we certainly don’t want egos. We are a small team where everyone is expected to support each other. There is no need or tolerance for sharp elbows.

We like people who thrive in uncertainty and see it as an opportunity. We like people who think creatively and commercially, always thinking about how we can enhance our market position. At interview, we like hearing about the knocks people have taken and how they’ve bounced back – because overcoming adversity is a critical skill for a high-growth challenger consultancy with a big vision.

We are looking for candidates with the following qualifications and experience:


A degree from a reputable university
Experience building excel models and managing data
Experience of financial analysis and research
Strong data analysis and data visualisation capabilities – experience in using PowerBI or similar tools ideal
Prior experience within the non-life insurance sector is advantageous but not essential
Willingness to travel to London if based in Belfast
Strong personal and professional motivation


About Oxbow Partners

Oxbow Partners is a rapidly growing specialist management consultancy for the insurance industry, supporting our clients on growth, operations, technology strategy and M&A.

The firm was founded in 2015 to provide a “fresh perspective” to our clients and has since been recognised as one of the top consulting firms in the UK for the insurance industry by the Financial Times since 2021.

Based in London and working internationally, our clients include leaders in the global reinsurance market, established and start-up Lloyd’s and speciality players, UK&I domestic insurers and private equity investors. We have also established ourselves as leading experts on ESG and Gen AI, topics increasingly in focus for insurance executives around the world.

We are very proud to also be a Certified B Corporation, reflecting the ethical way we run our business, including a focus on diversity and inclusion. This makes us unique amongst strategy consulting firms.

Oxbow Partners ambition is to be the most trusted, best informed and most entrepreneurial insurance advisory firm and have more fun delivering than any of our competitors.

To learn more about us, please visit www.oxbowpartners.com.

Why work at Oxbow Partners?

Oxbow Partners combines the best of “big consulting” with the excitement and creativity of a high growth company.


We are a fast-growing firm and you’ll have an exciting ride – as a member of our team you’ll be building a business, not just doing projects
We empower our team members to grow as quickly as they can – there is no hierarchy to keep you in your box
We work on challenging and industry-shaping topics – you’ll quickly find yourself delivering insights to senior leaders at some of the world’s largest institutions
We are a premium brand. Clients know that our people are both world class consultants and experts in our field
We invest heavily in the wellbeing of our teams and have a far better work-life balance than many of our larger competitors


Our Values

Our values guide everything we do and the way we behave at Oxbow Partners:


Strive to be the best, but humble enough to recognise there’s always much to learn
Be hard on facts, even when it means giving tough messages…
…but soft on people
Imperfect impact trumps perfect analysis
Build the brand, and the business will build itself


To apply, please send a CV and covering letter to careers@oxbowpartners.com.
Show more

We are looking for candidates with the following qualifications and experience:

  • A degree from a reputable university
  • Experience building excel models and managing data
  • Experience of financial analysis and research
  • Strong data analysis and data visualisation capabilities – experience in using PowerBI or similar tools ideal
  • Prior experience within the non-life insurance sector is advantageous but not essential
  • Willingness to travel to London if based in Belfast
  • Strong personal and professional motivation

About Oxbow Partners

Oxbow Partners is a rapidly growing specialist management consultancy for the insurance industry, supporting our clients on growth, operations, technology strategy and M&A.

The firm was founded in 2015 to provide a “fresh perspective” to our clients and has since been recognised as one of the top consulting firms in the UK for the insurance industry by the Financial Times since 2021.

Based in London and working internationally, our clients include leaders in the global reinsurance market, established and start-up Lloyd’s and speciality players, UK&I domestic insurers and private equity investors. We have also established ourselves as leading experts on ESG and Gen AI, topics increasingly in focus for insurance executives around the world.

We are very proud to also be a Certified B Corporation, reflecting the ethical way we run our business, including a focus on diversity and inclusion. This makes us unique amongst strategy consulting firms.

Oxbow Partners ambition is to be the most trusted, best informed and most entrepreneurial insurance advisory firm and have more fun delivering than any of our competitors.

To learn more about us, please visit www.oxbowpartners.com.

Why work at Oxbow Partners?

Oxbow Partners combines the best of “big consulting” with the excitement and creativity of a high growth company.

  • We are a fast-growing firm and you’ll have an exciting ride – as a member of our team you’ll be building a business, not just doing projects
  • We empower our team members to grow as quickly as they can – there is no hierarchy to keep you in your box
  • We work on challenging and industry-shaping topics – you’ll quickly find yourself delivering insights to senior leaders at some of the world’s largest institutions
  • We are a premium brand. Clients know that our people are both world class consultants and experts in our field
  • We invest heavily in the wellbeing of our teams and have a far better work-life balance than many of our larger competitors

Our Values

Our values guide everything we do and the way we behave at Oxbow Partners:

  • Strive to be the best, but humble enough to recognise there’s always much to learn
  • Be hard on facts, even when it means giving tough messages…
  • …but soft on people
  • Imperfect impact trumps perfect analysis
  • Build the brand, and the business will build itself

To apply, please send a CV and covering letter to careers@oxbowpartners.com.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
The Business Data Analyst will be responsible for supporting data-driven decision-making across Mirion Medical with a focus on reporting, data management, financial reporting, and master data management. Reporting directly to the S&OP Leader for the Medical Business, this role will collaborate with executives and teams across all four Mirion Medical businesses globally. The Business Analyst will provide critical insights through data analysis and visualization, ensuring data consistency, integrity, and alignment with business goals. This position will also contribute to the financial reporting processes, ensuring alignment with broader business objectives.

Key Areas of Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain reports that provide actionable insights into business performance, supporting both operational and financial decision-making for the Medical Business.
Utilize data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to present complex data and financial reports clearly for business leaders.
Analyze business, operational, and financial data to identify trends, inefficiencies, and opportunities for process improvement across all Mirion Medical businesses.
Work closely with the S&OP Leader for the Medical Business to ensure alignment of reporting and analytics with global business priorities, including financial performance.
Collaborate with executives and key stakeholders across all Mirion Medical businesses to drive consistency and alignment in reporting practices and data analysis.
Design, implement, and automate financial and operational reporting processes to improve efficiency and reduce manual reporting efforts.
Support the maintenance and management of master data, ensuring accuracy and consistency across systems in accordance with best practices.
Monitor and evaluate key performance indicators (KPIs) across both financial and operational metrics, providing insights and recommendations for business improvements.
Contribute to data governance initiatives to maintain high-quality, reliable, and compliant business data.
Assist in continuous improvement efforts for business analytics processes and tools to meet the evolving needs of the business.
Foster strong relationships with global teams to ensure alignment and collaboration across all Mirion Medical business units.

Skills and Experience:

2+ years of experience in business analytics, financial reporting, or data management.
Proficiency in Excel and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Solid understanding of business analytics, financial reporting, and data management principles.
Experience in analyzing financial performance, tracking key financial metrics, and providing financial insights.
Proven ability to collaborate with senior leaders and cross-functional teams to gather reporting requirements, define KPIs, and align reporting with business objectives.
Strong problem-solving skills, with a focus on process efficiency and continuous improvement.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to present complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with CRM tools such as Salesforce.
Detail-oriented with the ability to balance high-level strategic thinking with attention to day-to-day execution.

Academic Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in business, Data Analytics, Finance, or a related field with a strong analytical background.
Previous experience in business analytics or financial reporting within the medical device or healthcare industry is a plus.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Behavioral Health Data Analyst is responsible for leveraging data to uncover actionable insights that drive clinical, operational, and business decisions. This role requires expertise in healthcare analytics, specifically in interpreting clinical and operational data requests, managing large claims datasets, and developing data visualizations that effectively tell a story to diverse stakeholders. Proficiency with healthcare frameworks such as HEDIS, NCQA, and value-based care metrics is critical to success in this role.

Responsibilities

Collaborate with clinical and operational teams to translate requests into actionable queries and analytics that inform decision-making.
Analyze large datasets, including claims data, to uncover trends, identify risks, and generate insights related to cost, utilization, and quality.
Develop dashboards and visualizations in Power BI to present findings to both technical and non-technical audiences, tailoring presentations to executive stakeholders when necessary.
Design and implement frameworks for tracking healthcare performance metrics, including HEDIS, NCQA, and value-based care measures.
Perform data cleaning and validation to ensure the accuracy and reliability of datasets.
Create comprehensive reports that combine storytelling with quantitative insights to drive actionable recommendations.
Identify and communicate opportunities for process improvement or cost optimization through data analysis.
Support ad hoc requests for data analysis, ensuring timely and accurate delivery of results.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including clinicians, IT, and operations, to ensure alignment of data analytics with organizational goals.
Stay updated on industry trends, tools, and best practices in healthcare analytics.




Skills

Advanced proficiency in Power BI for developing dashboards and visualizations.
Strong SQL skills for querying relational databases and preparing datasets for analysis.
Experience with data cleaning and working with large, complex datasets.
In-depth understanding of healthcare performance metrics, including HEDIS, NCQA, and value-based care frameworks.
Exceptional storytelling skills to present data in a meaningful way to diverse stakeholders.
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving abilities to uncover insights and recommend solutions.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with an ability to explain complex data findings to non-technical audiences.




Qualifications




Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Data Analytics, Health Informatics, or a related field
3+ years of experience in healthcare analytics, with a strong focus on clinical and operational data.
Proven experience with claims data analysis, including familiarity with total cost of care and utilization metrics.




Preferred Qualifications

Master’s degree in Data Analytics, Business Analytics, Health Informatics, Public Health, or a related field.
Experience with Python or R for advanced analytics and statistical modeling.
Familiarity with Epic or other electronic medical records systems.
Certified Healthcare Data Analyst (CHDA) certification or similar credentials.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

The Data Analyst assists in the preparation, design and execution of models and data products to improve the academic and business outcomes of Stride. The position participates as a member of the analytics team identifying and analyzing school data, proprietary data, and third-party data to answer thoughtful and relevant research questions and provide replicable, well-documented analyses.

SUMMARY: The Data Science Analyst assists in the preparation, design and execution of models and data products to improve the academic and business outcomes of Stride. The position participates as a member of the analytics team identifying and analyzing school data, proprietary data, and third-party data to answer thoughtful and relevant research questions and provide replicable, well-documented analyses.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties.


Leverage products such as: DBT, SQL, Python and GitHub to collect, organize and model data sets for peak functionality per business requirement;
Design, Create, Deploy and Maintain various products and applications through the Power BI service;
Provide ad-hoc analyses to drive insights, provide overviews of major conclusions, constraints or cautions;
Build and manage cross functional relationships in order to synthetize data domain knowledge;
Support initiatives for data integrity and normalization including but not limited to data ownership;
Collaborate with the visualization & modeling teams to ensure cohesiveness between products;
Process confidential data and information according to guidelines;


Supervisory Responsibilities: This position has no formal supervisory responsibilities.

Required Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or related field
Five (5) years of relevant professional experience with BI tools and SQL modeling, including at least three (3) year of experience performing action and outcome-oriented data analysis OR
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases for BI products
OR Equivalent combination of education and experience
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to travel up to 10% of the time
Ability to clear required background check


Certificates and Licenses: None required.

Desired Qualifications


(2+) years modeling with DBT / Snowflake preferred
(3+) years developing BI products (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, etc.)
Experience in K12 education as a teacher, researcher or data personnel


WORK ENVIRONMENT: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


This position is virtual and open to residents of the 50 states and D.C.


Job Type

Regular

The above job is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of duties and standards of the position. Incumbents will follow any other instructions, and perform any other related duties, as assigned by their supervisor. All employment is “at-will” as governed by the law of the state where the employee works. It is further understood that the “at-will” nature of employment is one aspect of employment that cannot be changed except in writing and signed by an authorized officer.

If you are a job seeker with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to apply for one of our jobs, you can request the appropriate accommodation by contacting stridecareers@k12.com.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals With Disabilities

Stride, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants receive consideration for employment based on merit without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state, or local law. Stride, Inc. complies with all legally required affirmative action obligations. Applicants will not be discriminated against because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Location: In-Office | Highpoint – 14100 58th St N, Clearwater, FL 33760

Schedule: Full-time, Monday–Friday |

Exempt/Salaried




Data that drives change. Work that matters.




At Evara Health, we believe that access to quality healthcare should never be limited by circumstance. As a Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC) with 18 locations throughout Pinellas County, we serve more than 75,000 patients annually, offering comprehensive care including Primary Care, Dental, Pediatrics, Behavioral Health, and more.




As we grow, so does our need for strategic, data-driven decision-making. That’s why we’re looking for a Data Analyst who can transform raw numbers into powerful insights that directly impact patient outcomes, organizational strategy, and community health.




If you want to do work that matters—and be part of a mission-driven culture that truly values its people—this is your opportunity.







Why this role matters

As a Data Analyst on the Evara Health team, you’ll build dashboards and reports that directly support clinical outcomes, population health, performance tracking, and grant and regulatory reporting. You’ll work closely with clinical, operational, and executive leaders to turn raw data into meaningful insights—helping drive decisions that improve care for thousands of patients.




If you're an experienced analyst with strong healthcare experience, deep technical skills in SQL and Power BI, and the ability to collaborate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders—you’ll thrive here.







What you’ll do

Build dashboards and dynamic reports: Develop and maintain visualizations using Power BI and SQL across clinical, operational, and financial datasets.
Work with clinical and healthcare data: Extract and analyze EHR (Epic) data to support clinical program performance, grant tracking, and population health management.
Collaborate cross-functionally: Partner with leaders, clinicians, and administrators to understand data needs, present insights, and build tailored solutions that drive action.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity: Conduct data validation, troubleshoot discrepancies, and uphold reporting standards across multiple systems.
Deliver timely and accurate reporting: Produce recurring and ad hoc reports for leadership, grant partners, and external stakeholders that are aligned with regulatory and strategic goals.
Support compliance and risk management: Assist with data for audits, risk reviews, and compliance tracking—ensuring reporting meets federal, state, and internal requirements.







You’re a strong candidate if you...

Have 3–5 years of hands-on experience building dashboards and reports using Power BI and SQL
Have direct experience working with clinical data in a healthcare setting (hospital, health system, FQHC, or provider group strongly preferred)
Have a working knowledge of Epic (or similar EHR platforms)
Understand how to interpret and present data to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Possess strong business acumen and communication skills—you know how to ask the right questions and deliver clear, actionable insights
Are proactive, curious, and detail-oriented, with a passion for solving problems that make a real-world impact
Hold a degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Healthcare Informatics, or a related field; data analytics certifications (e.g., Power BI, Google, Tableau) are a plus







Total Rewards That Go Beyond the Basics

At Evara Health, we believe great people make great organizations. That’s why we offer one of the most generous and unique benefits packages in our industry:

36 days of paid time off to start (25 PTO, 10 holidays, 1 birthday)
Quarterly performance-based bonus payouts
4% employer contributions to your retirement—no match required
90% employer-paid healthcare premiums
Up to $1,000/year in HSA contributions
Free or discounted healthcare at Evara Health facilities
Free gym memberships and public transportation access (PTSA)
$1,500/year in education assistance for certifications, training, or formal education
A mission-driven workplace with record-breaking engagement scores and a supportive, innovative culture







Ready to turn healthcare data into life-changing outcomes?




At Evara Health, this isn’t just a data role. It’s a chance to work with purpose—translating insights into action, and action into impact.




Apply today and join a team driven by purpose and powered by people.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst I
Description:
The Data Solutions Analyst supports data initiatives through the delivery of data pipelines, reports, and dashboards. They ensure data sourced for pipelines, reports, and dashboards they deliver are from quality data sources while also supporting data preparation requirements for analytics team members. The Data Solutions Analyst serves as a front-line data user that supports manual and automated data quality processes to ensure company data is maintained at a high quality. Through this function, the Data Solutions Analyst also recommends methodologies to improve data quality and analytical preparation processes. Additionally, they serve as a source for business requirements for strategic data initiatives.

Position Responsibilities

Reporting


Deliver ad hoc reports and dashboards based on documented business requirements. Maintain data and visualization capabilities of developed data assets to ensure quality and support reuse.
Support reporting capabilities as a part of a delivery team executing consultative insights and analysis to business decisionmakers.
Perform routine quality checks on existing data assets to ensure integrity and support issue troubleshooting and remediation.
Provide subject matter expertise and requirements on long-term data strategy efforts designed to harden ad hoc reports and dashboards.


Data Wrangling


Manipulate and integrate data from existing data products, pipelines, and reports to support data value delivery.
Perform ad hoc data quality checks and manual fixes on pipeline data to support data quality management and issue remediation processes.
Integrate data from various sources to support documented business requirements.
Comply with information lifecycle management and data governance policies, standards, and guidelines.


Decision Science


Support Lead Analysts and Information Architects by provisioning data from non-standard sources as needed.
Collaborate with team members on business intelligence and visualization requirements to support insight delivery efforts.
With direction, delivers insights/analysis on business performance based on KPIs and metrics to support broader analytical initiatives.
With supervision, support business insight delivery on internal consulting projects of moderate complexity.


Position Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, or other relevant technology degrees or a High School Diploma or GED with 6 years of progressively responsible experience
2 years of Technology experience and proficiency
1 year of experience in data structures and data modeling
1 year of experience in data visualization techniques experience (Power BI, Tableau)
This position is not eligible for sponsorship. Must have indefinite employment authorization.


Preferred Qualifications


1 year of experience documenting and assisting product owners with creating system/business requirements
1 year of experience with Microsoft Office and expanded product lines (Visio, MS Project, SharePoint)
1 year of experience in banking or related industries Experience in data profiling, statistical analysis, data analysis, and data standardization / cleansing techniques
Strong SQL skills with the ability to write sophisticated queriers across large, complex data sets
Experience using statistical techniques to discover the root cause of data quality issues and recommend remediation options
Ability to analyze data trends, identify patterns and proactively address potential data quality issues
Experience with Collibra, Informatica, and Snowflake (Python, R is a plus)
This position is not eligible for sponsorship. Must have indefinite employment authorization.


Work Best Category

Category C - Days in the office will either be designated days or will vary week to week from 2-5 days

Hours

8:00am - 5:00pm Monday - Friday

Salary

To Be Determined Based on Individual Experience

About Comerica

We know our employees are critical to our overall success and we are dedicated to investing in their future. One of the ways we do this is to offer a comprehensive Total Rewards package designed to recognize and reward individual performance, as well support health, well-being, development and security for our colleagues and their family. Total Rewards consists of cash compensation, development and flexible benefit programs designed to meet individual needs today and in the future. Your salary will be commensurate with your work experience and our programs are reviewed regularly to ensure each remain competitive. We are proud to offer benefits such as health and welfare programs, strong retirement benefits, and generous paid time off programs. You and your eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children, can participate in medical, dental, and vision benefits, 401(k) and pension, income protection benefits such as life insurance, AD&D, and supplemental health programs to offset unexpected health care expenses. We also have a variety of time off programs for things like vacation, sick time, disability, and parental leave. Eligibility for some programs varies based on employment status and tenure.

Upon offer, Comerica conducts a comprehensive background and fingerprint check.

NMLS certification requirement: where applicable, a favorable background check screening, credit check, fingerprint check, and NMLS certification is required in accordance with the SAFE Act.

Comerica Incorporated (NYSE: CMA) is a financial services company headquartered in Dallas, Texas, and strategically aligned into three major business segments; the Commercial Bank, the Retail Bank, and Wealth Management. Comerica's colleagues focus on relationships, and helping people and businesses be successful. In addition to Texas, Comerica Bank locations can be found in Arizona, California, Florida and Michigan, with select businesses operating in several other states, as well as in Canada and Mexico.

Comerica is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer - veterans/individuals with disabilities, committed to workplace diversity.
Show more
HTML:
The Data Solutions Analyst supports data initiatives through the delivery of data pipelines, reports, and dashboards. They ensure data sourced for pipelines, reports, and dashboards they deliver are from quality data sources while also supporting data preparation requirements for analytics team members. The Data Solutions Analyst serves as a front-line data user that supports manual and automated data quality processes to ensure company data is maintained at a high quality. Through this function, the Data Solutions Analyst also recommends methodologies to improve data quality and analytical preparation processes. Additionally, they serve as a source for business requirements for strategic data initiatives.

Position Responsibilities

Reporting

  • Deliver ad hoc reports and dashboards based on documented business requirements. Maintain data and visualization capabilities of developed data assets to ensure quality and support reuse.
  • Support reporting capabilities as a part of a delivery team executing consultative insights and analysis to business decisionmakers.
  • Perform routine quality checks on existing data assets to ensure integrity and support issue troubleshooting and remediation.
  • Provide subject matter expertise and requirements on long-term data strategy efforts designed to harden ad hoc reports and dashboards.

Data Wrangling

  • Manipulate and integrate data from existing data products, pipelines, and reports to support data value delivery.
  • Perform ad hoc data quality checks and manual fixes on pipeline data to support data quality management and issue remediation processes.
  • Integrate data from various sources to support documented business requirements.
  • Comply with information lifecycle management and data governance policies, standards, and guidelines.

Decision Science

  • Support Lead Analysts and Information Architects by provisioning data from non-standard sources as needed.
  • Collaborate with team members on business intelligence and visualization requirements to support insight delivery efforts.
  • With direction, delivers insights/analysis on business performance based on KPIs and metrics to support broader analytical initiatives.
  • With supervision, support business insight delivery on internal consulting projects of moderate complexity.

Position Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, or other relevant technology degrees or a High School Diploma or GED with 6 years of progressively responsible experience
  • 2 years of Technology experience and proficiency
  • 1 year of experience in data structures and data modeling
  • 1 year of experience in data visualization techniques experience (Power BI, Tableau)
  • This position is not eligible for sponsorship. Must have indefinite employment authorization.

Preferred Qualifications

  • 1 year of experience documenting and assisting product owners with creating system/business requirements
  • 1 year of experience with Microsoft Office and expanded product lines (Visio, MS Project, SharePoint)
  • 1 year of experience in banking or related industries Experience in data profiling, statistical analysis, data analysis, and data standardization / cleansing techniques
  • Strong SQL skills with the ability to write sophisticated queriers across large, complex data sets
  • Experience using statistical techniques to discover the root cause of data quality issues and recommend remediation options
  • Ability to analyze data trends, identify patterns and proactively address potential data quality issues
  • Experience with Collibra, Informatica, and Snowflake (Python, R is a plus)
  • This position is not eligible for sponsorship. Must have indefinite employment authorization.

Work Best Category

Category C - Days in the office will either be designated days or will vary week to week from 2-5 days

Hours

8:00am - 5:00pm Monday - Friday

Salary

To Be Determined Based on Individual Experience

About Comerica

We know our employees are critical to our overall success and we are dedicated to investing in their future. One of the ways we do this is to offer a comprehensive Total Rewards package designed to recognize and reward individual performance, as well support health, well-being, development and security for our colleagues and their family. Total Rewards consists of cash compensation, development and flexible benefit programs designed to meet individual needs today and in the future. Your salary will be commensurate with your work experience and our programs are reviewed regularly to ensure each remain competitive. We are proud to offer benefits such as health and welfare programs, strong retirement benefits, and generous paid time off programs. You and your eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children, can participate in medical, dental, and vision benefits, 401(k) and pension, income protection benefits such as life insurance, AD&D, and supplemental health programs to offset unexpected health care expenses. We also have a variety of time off programs for things like vacation, sick time, disability, and parental leave. Eligibility for some programs varies based on employment status and tenure.

Upon offer, Comerica conducts a comprehensive background and fingerprint check.

NMLS certification requirement: where applicable, a favorable background check screening, credit check, fingerprint check, and NMLS certification is required in accordance with the SAFE Act.

Comerica Incorporated (NYSE: CMA) is a financial services company headquartered in Dallas, Texas, and strategically aligned into three major business segments; the Commercial Bank, the Retail Bank, and Wealth Management. Comerica's colleagues focus on relationships, and helping people and businesses be successful. In addition to Texas, Comerica Bank locations can be found in Arizona, California, Florida and Michigan, with select businesses operating in several other states, as well as in Canada and Mexico.

Comerica is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer - veterans/individuals with disabilities, committed to workplace diversity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Borrowell:

At Borrowell, we're on a mission to help Canadians feel confident about their money. We empower individuals to take control of their financial futures by providing the tools and insights needed to understand, build, and use their credit effectively.

1 in 10 Canadians use Borrowell for comprehensive credit monitoring and personalized insights. Our innovative services, including Credit Builder and rent reporting, help consumers build credit so they can unlock access to a wider range of financial products at more competitive rates. Additionally, we offer personalized financial product recommendations from Canada's most trusted providers based on each member's credit profile and financial goals.

Our team is diverse, inclusive, and driven by a shared passion for making a meaningful difference in the lives of Canadians. We pride ourselves on fostering a culture of collaboration, humility, and innovation. If you're looking to join a company that's transforming the financial landscape and empowering Canadians to achieve their financial aspirations, we invite you to explore career opportunities at Borrowell. Together, we can help Canadians feel confident about money.

About this role:

As a Data Analyst you will be a key member of Borrowell's Data Analytics Team. Your role will be pivotal in informing new marketing and product initiatives and powering the recommendations we personalize to each of our 3+ million members.

You'll provide a window into business performance and help to make recommendations on what we build next. You can expect to be responsible for creating and managing insights, experimentations, forecasting, and reporting for various business partners at Borrowell. You'll monitor existing key performance indicators, explore new areas of data to drive business growth and product development, and make company data accessible, insightful and actionable to the different business divisions.

This role specifically focuses on being a data thought partner to a designated Product Manager and related cross-functional Product pod (in-house folks in engineering, devops, QA, mobile, and more).

Responsibilities


Establish and maintain KPIs and supporting metrics to be used across the project to track performance
Analyze data from different sources
Collaborate across functions to identify data analytics problems and execute solutions with data-driven insights
Translate product requirements into clear and actionable data tasks
Generate visualizations and use data insights to make recommendations and achieve goals
Perform A/B tests to ensure experiment results are reliable, valid and accurate



Requirements


1+ yrs working experience with SQL to solve business problems
Experience with using data to tell a story that is comprehensive for both technical and non-technical audiences
Experience with analytics tools such as Looker, Tableau, or similar (we use Looker)
Experience with A/B testing
Strong statistical knowledge



Nice to Have


Undergraduate (or higher) degree in a quantitative field
Knowledge of Python, R, dbt, or Airflow
Exposure to product-based tech startups



Benefits


The Opportunity - join and have a major impact at a growing company that is helping make financial stability possible for everybody
Comprehensive Health Benefits - medical, dental, vision, and paramedical health benefits for you and your family, with extra yearly coverage for psychotherapists and massage therapists
Additional Health Benefits - virtual benefit offering that allows you to connect 24/7 with nurses, doctors and mental health professionals
Maternity & Parental Leave Top-up - available to new parents
Wellness & Transit Benefit - $600 annually to spend on whatever brings you joy
WFH Reimbursement - we ship you gear like a laptop, mouse, keyboard, and you can reimburse additional items to make your workplace better for you
Employee Development Benefit - annual reimbursements on payments to help your learning
Givewell Benefit - 1 paid volunteer day a year to give back to the community
Flexibility - flexible working hours and a flexible vacation policy



We are remote-first across Canada with an office in Toronto. This role requires you to attend in-person meetings and team-building events.

At Borrowell, one of our core values and firm beliefs is that diversity makes us better. If you're unsure about your qualifications for this position we'd still encourage you to apply. We're looking for candidates who have experience but know that not everyone's had a chance to demonstrate what they can do. What's most important is that you have a growth mindset and care about helping people with their finances - an area in their lives that causes a lot of stress.

Please note that due to the sensitive nature of the work we do, clearing a credit and criminal record check is a condition of employment.

By submitting your application you consent to Borrowell's use and processing of your personal information in connection with your job application at Borrowell and its recruitment processes.

Borrowell encourages applications from candidates with differing abilities. Please let us know if you require accommodation at any stage in the selection process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At ING we are looking for a Data Analyst




Your role and work environment:




We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our Human Connection Strategy Team of Human Connection tribe.




If you are passionate about turning data into actionable insights and enjoy working directly with stakeholders to influence strategic decisions, this role is for you.




We are seeking someone who, in additions to being technically proficient, can translate complex data insights into clear business recommendations, communicate effectively with non-technical audiences, and contribute to driving key initiatives within the organization.




Your key responsibilities:




As a Data analyst you will:




Translate data into insights that inform strategic and operational decisions across the business.
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs, co-create analytical approaches, and present results in a way that drives action.
Prepare and deliver high-impact presentations and data-driven narratives for senior leadership and cross-functional teams.
Bridge the gap between data and business, ensuring insights are understandable and actionable.
Collaborate with other teams in an International and agile environment, ensuring alignment and consistent communication.




What are we looking for?




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits… don’t hesitate to apply!




For us, a Data analyst is someone who:




Knows about:




Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Business, Engineering, or similar.
3-4 years of experience in data analytics, business analytics, consulting, or related roles.
Solid knowledge of SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., power BI, Tableau) python or R is a plus but not essential.
Strong experience in data storytelling and creating business presentations.
Fluent English (spoken and written)
Understanding of business strategy and kpis to connect data insights with tangible business outcomes




Can:




Communicate complex data insights clearly and persuasively to non-technical stakeholders.
Proactively identify opportunities where data can add value and influence key decisions.




Loves to:




Collaborate in multidisciplinary teams, contributing to both technical and strategic conversations.
Present and defend your ideas with confidence and openness to feedback.




Defines himself/herself as a:




A team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Flexible, dynamic, and eager to work in fast-paced changing environments.




What do we offer?




The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but… What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.




Check out what is waiting for you!




Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues’ needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.




Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn’t take up your time or your cravings.




Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!




Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).




Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.




Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids…




Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.




Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!




More vitality and more belonging

360º care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+), Leonas & RIÑG.

International Remote work program.







Get to know Us




We are a team of more than 1700 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.




A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.




And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.




We are proud to have a diverse team, and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.




And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clients decide to embark on this journey.




Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead—that’s our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working…we are looking forward to meeting you!

International Remote work program.



Get to know Us


We are a team of more than 1700 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.


A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.


And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.


We are proud to have a diverse team, and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.


And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clients decide to embark on this journey.


Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead—that’s our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working…we are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Who We Are

Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world’s largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.

We are feeding the world’s curiosity!

Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our Data Science & Analytics team in delivering high-quality insights through data exploration, analysis, and reporting. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, comfortable working with large datasets, automating processes, and supporting internal stakeholders with data-driven recommendations.

Responsibilities


Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights, ensuring quality and reliability of results.
Respond to ad hoc client-specific requests including performing analyses, data manipulation and producing summary results.
Generate reports and visualizations to effectively communicate findings to stakeholders to support decision making
Support campaign performance analysis and contribute to benchmark development and optimization.
Design scripts and tools to automate and streamline data extraction processes using Python, SQL, and APIs.
Develop interactive dashboards and reporting tools (such as Power BI, Tableau, Streamlit) to provide a clear overview of key metrics and insights.
Collaborate with stakeholders to enhance data collection processes.


Qualifications

Required:


Master’s degree or Bachelors in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics or a related discipline).
1-2 year(s) of experience in a data analysis role, preferably in market research, or advertising analytics.
Proficiency in Python (especially pandas and NumPy) for data manipulation.
Strong experience with MS Excel for analysis and reporting.
Experience working with large datasets and performing complex data transformations.
Strong analytical skills with a focus on data validation and accuracy.
Excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate with internal teams and customers.
Self-starter with ability to work independently.


Additional Information

Nice to Have:


Experience in media measurement analytics.
Ability to write and optimize SQL queries.
Familiarity with Streamlit, Power BI, or Tableau for dashboarding.
Understanding of Databricks or similar cloud-based analytics platforms.


Our Values

Collaboration is our superpower


We uncover rich perspectives across the world
Success happens together
We deliver across borders.


Innovation is in our blood


We’re pioneers in our industry
Our curiosity is insatiable
We bring the best ideas to life.


We Do What We Say


We’re accountable for our work and actions
Excellence comes as standard
We’re open, honest and kind, always.


We are caring


We learn from each other’s experiences
Stop and listen; every opinion matters
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.


More About Cint

In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish – the world’s largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region – and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid – a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.

Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
En Wetaca queremos convertirnos en un movimiento de gente que quiere vivir bien en todos los sentidos.




El ritmo de vida actual lleva a muchas personas a tener que elegir entre comer comer rico y comer sano o a priorizar la rapidez, dejando en un segundo plano la calidad y sabor de lo que comen en su día a día. Por eso en Wetaca cocinamos para que comer genial esté al alcance de todos y la comida sea un sinónimo de disfrute, bienestar y tranquilidad.




Somos la suscripción semanal de comida a domicilio líder del mercado y repartimos en toda la península. Cocinamos comida casera y real (con ingredientes naturales, sin aditivos ni conservantes y todo desde cero) para ofrecer menús variados y para todos los gustos, para que nuestros clientes coman bien y ganen tiempo para sí mismos. Nuestro objetivo es que confíen en nosotros y nos deleguen el preparar su comida, que sepan que We TAke CAre, que nosotros nos encargamos de todo.




Si eres una persona con hambre y buscas un sitio en el que crecer, tenemos una vacante para ti.




Buscamos un Product Data Analyst con 2-3 años de experiencia, capaz de entender las necesidades del producto digital y transformarlas en datos e insights accionables para mejorar la experiencia de nuestros usuarios. Formará parte del equipo de producto digital, desempeñando un rol clave en el análisis del comportamiento de los usuarios y la evaluación del impacto de nuevas funcionalidades, ayudándonos a descubrir oportunidades de negocio.




¿Qué harás?

Potencia la toma de decisiones en un equipo de producto digital.

Autonomía para plantear hipótesis e identificar qué información es clave para responder preguntas de negocio y producto.
Extraer y analizar datos directamente desde fuentes como SQL y Google Analytics con un enfoque técnico y proactivo.
Conocimientos en Python/R para procesamiento y análisis avanzado de datos.
Capacidad para procesar y estructurar consultas.
Detectar tendencias en datos históricos y proyectar futuros comportamientos para guiar la toma de decisiones.
Medir y validar hipótesis de experimentos y pruebas A/B.
Preparar informes para responder a preguntas clave utilizando herramientas como Looker, Power BI o similares.




En definitiva, colaborar de cerca con Producto, Diseño y IT para identificar oportunidades de crecimiento y mejorar la experiencia del usuario con datos.




¿Quién eres?

2-3 años de experiencia en un rol analítico, aportando insights accionables.
Formación o experiencia en disciplinas cuantitativas (Economía, Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería, etc.).
Sólidos conocimientos de lenguajes de programación y herramientas de análisis y procesamiento de datos: SQL, Python, R.
Base en estadística y experimentación (A/B testing, cohort analysis, modelos de segmentación).
Habilidad para visualizar datos y comunicar insights de forma clara y accionable.
Mentalidad analítica y colaborativa, con ganas de trabajar codo a codo con Producto, Diseño y Tech.




¿Cómo estarás?

Trabajarás en un equipo donde los datos son clave para la estrategia, no un complemento.
Tendrás autonomía para explorar y proponer mejoras basadas en insights reales.
Ambiente colaborativo, con espacio para aprender y crecer en el mundo de producto digital.

Show more

Formará parte del equipo de producto digital, desempeñando un rol clave en el análisis del comportamiento de los usuarios y la evaluación del impacto de nuevas funcionalidades, ayudándonos a descubrir oportunidades de negocio.


¿Qué harás?

Potencia la toma de decisiones en un equipo de producto digital.

  • Autonomía para plantear hipótesis e identificar qué información es clave para responder preguntas de negocio y producto.
  • Extraer y analizar datos directamente desde fuentes como SQL y Google Analytics con un enfoque técnico y proactivo.
  • Conocimientos en Python/R para procesamiento y análisis avanzado de datos.
  • Capacidad para procesar y estructurar consultas.

  • Medir y validar hipótesis de experimentos y pruebas A/B.

  • Habilidad para visualizar datos y comunicar insights de forma clara y accionable.
  • Mentalidad analítica y colaborativa, con ganas de trabajar codo a codo con Producto, Diseño y Tech.


¿Cómo estarás?

  • Trabajarás en un equipo donde los datos son clave para la estrategia, no un complemento.
  • Tendrás autonomía para explorar y proponer mejoras basadas en insights reales.
  • Ambiente colaborativo, con espacio para aprender y crecer en el mundo de producto digital.

Title: Data Analyst (Fashion Days Team)
HTML:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.

More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams . We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster !

Data Analyst (Fashion Days Team)

Fashion Days through eMAG IT is looking for a Data Analyst to join their Fashion Days Platform Team. We need a person with background in Data Analysis to help us leverage data to enhance our customer experience and satisfaction. As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with stakeholders across the organization to understand their data needs and provide them with relevant insights and recommendations to support business decisions and goals.

What You’ll Have To Do

  • Gather, aggregate and analyze data from various sources, such as internal databases, Google Analytics and BigQuery to provide insights and support decision-making processes;
  • Work closely with your colleagues in improving the current tracking and develop new flows according to business needs;
  • Analyze and interpret complex data sets to identify patterns and insights in customer journey (such as traffic sources, conversion rates, purchase frequency);
  • Perform regularly data checks to ensure data accuracy, integrity and accessibility for analysis purposes;
  • Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using data visualization tools to communicate insights effectively to stakeholders;
  • Work together with product and marketing teams to provide data-driven recommendations for improving user experience;
  • Stay updated with industry best practices and emerging trends in e-commerce analytics, tracking and user behavior analysis.

What Makes You a Good Fit

  • University degree in Economics, Computer Science, or equivalent professional experience;
  • Have 2+ years’ experience as a Data Analyst or similar positions;
  • Have SQL experience;
  • Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to work with complex datasets;
  • Able to translate business problems into quantitative analyses and produce useful insights;
  • Have excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate effectively with teams;
  • Detail-oriented and able to work independently;
  • Excellent English communication skills (spoken and written).

What makes you stand out: (optional)

  • Knowledge of Big Query and Google Analytics;
  • Familiarity with Python;
  • Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Looker Studio.

What We’ve Prepared For You

  • Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
  • A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Tazz, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
  • Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
  • Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Hilio psycho-emotional health platform.
  • An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
  • New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.

Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Team

Backing Uber's creativity with operational efficiency. This is the Team's mission statement. In essence, the Team helps Uber to scale and best serve its users by performing work around two main pillars i) Analytics & Automation - data science, data analysis, query & dashboard creation, automation of business process, ii) Process - design, execution & optimization of business processes. Located in Krakow, the Team is centralizing work for Uber Rides & Uber Eats, covering two mega-regions, i) United States & Canada, ii) Europe, Middle East, and Africa. This experience gained as Data Analyst may also, going forward, open doors to plenty of new opportunities across the world, via the Uber Mobility Program. We're offering a hybrid model of working (50% based out of our Krakow office, 50% work from home).

About The Role

After creating queries and dashboards, you will proceed to significant data analyses in order to provide insightful recommendations to Stakeholders, valuable inputs for strategic decisions. As Data Analyst, you will work together with other Team Members: Process Optimization Specialists and Automation Specialists. This is a great opportunity if you want to further develop your analytical skills, build sophisticated dashboards, use tools such as Data Studio, Google Sheets or Tableau and create actionable insights for large-scale operations, with concrete impacts.

What You'll Do


Analyze data, identify trends and build meaningful recommendations
Present your results in a concise manner to international Stakeholders
Design, lead & execute projects independently or in coordination with peers
Conduct root cause analyses, build dashboards, prepare data-driven proposals


What You'll Need


Good knowledge in SQL, Google Sheets
Analytical and data-driven approach for solving problems
Ability to work independently, on your own initiative
Motivation to learn all along the way and improve continuously
Excellent written and spoken Communication (in English)

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.


More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams. We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!


Data Analyst


What you'll have to do:


  • Build up strong relationships with suppliers to deliver effective and profitable plans.
  • Drive the conception, implementation, and development of the BI reporting landscape. This includes understanding stakeholder business needs, drafting specifications and monitoring/reviewing implementation with the BI team;
  • Act as a business partner and advisor for the commercial and financial department. Some recurrent needs can be solved with the help of the BI team, while other custom solutions should be provided by us. This means accessing and processing the data in a way that answers those needs;
  • Present results in a well-structured, efficient, and clear manner;
  • Derivate strategic recommendations based on comprehensive data analysis;
  • Standardize processes and reporting for enhanced efficiency;
  • Prepare ad-hoc reports and draw conclusions related to profitability, deliveries, product availability, active promotions, inventory levels, etc. based on stakeholder requests;
  • Offer support on data gathering, consolidation and verifications within the finance team.


What makes you a good fit:


  • 1-4 years of professional experience in data analysis;
  • Extensive knowledge of Excel and writing SQL queries;
  • Intermediate knowledge of Pandas (Python);
  • Intermediate knowledge of BI tools (Tableau);
  • Strong organizational skills, ability to work independently, with a focus on quality, detail, and accuracy;
  • Quick comprehension and ability to grasp new topics in detail;
  • Enthusiasm for developing, organizing, and analyzing large datasets;
  • Ability to describe complicated issues concisely and understandably;
  • High-quality standards for your own work;
  • Excellent spoken and written English skills.


What we've prepared for you:


  • Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
  • A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
  • Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
  • Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Hilio psycho-emotional health platform.
  • An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
  • New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.


Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Prosegur es la empresa líder en seguridad en España. Con más de 32.000 empleados a nivel nacional y más de 190.000 a nivel internacional, tiene presencia en más de 22 países y más de 700 sedes repartidas por todo el mundo.

Todo ello hace de Prosegur una gran empresa que ofrece grandes posibilidades de desarrollo profesional. Prosegur es un excelente lugar para trabajar por muchas razones: Una gran compañía, Grandes retos y oportunidades, Innovación, Los mejores profesionales y las mejores personas y Aportación a la sociedad. Además en Prosegur vivimos nuestros valores con pasión, son algo que nos define y por eso, nos gusta ponerlos de manifiesto en nuestro trabajo todos los días y compartirlos.




¡QUEREMOS CRECER CONTIGO!




¿Cuál será tu día a día?

-Análisis de datos, creación de dashboards y reportes que ayuden en la toma de decisiones del área Comercial.

-Implementación de modelos de machine learning para predicción de resultados.

Optimización de base de datos y mejora en tiempos de consulta.

-Pensamiento analítico y resolución de problemas.

-Toma de requerimientos Preparación y análisis de los resultados de las ventas en relación con los objetivos marcados por la dirección y propuesta de acciones.

-Estudio de las variables que impactan en la comercialización de productos del negocio de Cash.

Participación en el diseño y elaboración de informes sobre la actividad comercial:

Oportunidades de negocio y ofertas realizadas.
Extracción y análisis de datos.
Propuesta de modificaciones y mejoras en los informes recurrentes.

-Actualización y mantenimiento de la aplicación de CRM, atendiendo a las necesidades de los usuarios:

-Colaborar en proyectos de agilización de procesos y procedimientos automatización.

-Colaborar activamente con el equipo Comercial.




¿Qué buscamos de ti?

Estudios superiores.
Idealmente con certificaciones en análisis de datos, SQL, PBI, Python
Imprescindible experiencia en Power BI, Microsoft Dynamics
Análisis de Manejo de herramientas de análisis de datos y bases de datos.
Dominio del Excel y herramientas de automatización.
Experiencia en gestión de proyectos




Valores

Orientación a resultados
Iniciativa
Trabajo en equipo
Habilidades comunicativas
Autonomía
Innovación
Capacidad de toma de decisiones




¿Qué te ofrecemos?

Contrato indefinido desde un primer momento.
Salario Fijo y variable.
Jornada completa.
Herramientas para desarrollar el trabajo: Tablet, móvil de empresa, herramientas de marketing.
Plan de carrera profesional.

dashboard related to IFCC and customer journey, data insights on campaigns

Title: Internship in Data Analysis and Reporting
Description:
Job description:

Data Analysis and Reporting Intern

Role Overview: As a Data Analysis and Reporting Intern, you will have the opportunity to support our corporate tutor in various critical activities related to data analysis and reporting.

Key Responsibilities: 

Data Warranty Analysis: Assist in analyzing warranty data submitted by our network.
Data Processing and Comparison: Process and compare data to generate insightful analyses.
Data Importation to Data Lake: Manage the importation of data into our centralized data lake, designed to store, process, and protect vast amounts of structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data.
Comprehensive Data Handling: Work with diverse data sets from the warranty database, regardless of size constraints.
Structured Report Generation: Develop structured reports to present complex data analyses in a clear and accessible manner.

 

Why Join Us?

Hands-On Experience: Gain practical experience with data analysis tools and techniques.
Mentorship: Receive guidance and mentorship from experienced professionals in the field.
Innovative Environment: Be part of a forward-thinking company that values creativity and innovation.

 

Ideal Candidate: 

Recent Graduate: A recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Management Engineering or a related field.
Analytical Mindset: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Tech-Savvy: Familiarity with data processing tools and software.
Detail-Oriented: Excellent attention to detail and the ability to manage large data sets.
Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills to present data findings effectively.

The selected candidate will be offered a 6-month extracurricular internship, including expense reimbursement and access to the company cafeteria. The position requires a commitment of 37 hours per week, from Monday to Friday.  

Internship location: Pontedera

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, provide digital marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them to save time and money.

Job Description

We are looking for an Associate Data Analyst, who will report to Head of Analytics - Identity and Fraud.

What You Are Going To Do


Extract, formulate and manipulate data to create the structured samples necessary to address requirements
Interpret analysis results
Identify and contribute to the resolution of data or analytical problems which may affect on results, looking for advice
Provide status reports to project lead/consultant
Communicate with clients and other departments/divisions within Experian to help ensure accurate implementation of project work
Attend and contribute to client/customer meetings, including presenting own results, conclusions and recommendations in both written and verbal form.


Qualifications

What you are expected to bring:


Degree or equivalent standard, with a high numeric content e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Operational Research, Economics, Physical Sciences.
Experience of statistical / analytical project work.
Understanding of how scoring models are used within implemented solutions.
PC literate with experience in the use of coding languages (namely Python, SAS), statistical packages and Office tools.
Knowledge of Experian ID&F products and scores. Understanding of how these are used within a client environment.
Basic knowledge of ID&F data and value added products and how these are used within a client environment.


What You Will Get


Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefits package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance for you and a family member, monthly flex allowance including internet bill coverage, sick leave allowance, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many more!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in social responsibility events.
Opportunity for flexible working hours and home office.

HTML:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, provide digital marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them to save time and money.

Job Description

We are looking for an Associate Data Analyst, who will report to Head of Analytics - Identity and Fraud.

What You Are Going To Do

  • Extract, formulate and manipulate data to create the structured samples necessary to address requirements
  • Interpret analysis results
  • Identify and contribute to the resolution of data or analytical problems which may affect on results, looking for advice
  • Provide status reports to project lead/consultant
  • Communicate with clients and other departments/divisions within Experian to help ensure accurate implementation of project work
  • Attend and contribute to client/customer meetings, including presenting own results, conclusions and recommendations in both written and verbal form.

Qualifications

What you are expected to bring:

  • Degree or equivalent standard, with a high numeric content e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Operational Research, Economics, Physical Sciences.
  • Experience of statistical / analytical project work.
  • Understanding of how scoring models are used within implemented solutions.
  • PC literate with experience in the use of coding languages (namely Python, SAS), statistical packages and Office tools.
  • Knowledge of Experian ID&F products and scores. Understanding of how these are used within a client environment.
  • Basic knowledge of ID&F data and value added products and how these are used within a client environment.

What You Will Get

  • Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
  • Social benefits package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance for you and a family member, monthly flex allowance including internet bill coverage, sick leave allowance, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many more!
  • Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in social responsibility events.
  • Opportunity for flexible working hours and home office.
  • Personal Development - career pathways for professional growth supported by learning and development programmes and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials and books.

Additional Information

Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mphasis is seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Analyst in Barcelona, Spain to support and enhance an Excel-based tool by integrating it with Databricks, improving data views, and making it scalable for broader business use. This role requires a strong foundation in data analysis, reporting, and process automation, with an emphasis on optimizing workflows and delivering actionable insights through reports and summaries.




About the Role:




Maintain and enhance an Excel-based tool, ensuring seamless integration with Databricks to automate data updates and improve efficiency.
Improve data views and dashboards, making them more intuitive, insightful, and scalable for various stakeholders.
Work on scalability solutions to expand the tool's functionality and adaptability across teams.
Develop and automate reports and summaries, translating complex data into actionable insights for decision-making.
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, business teams, and stakeholders to ensure the tool meets business needs and evolves with changing requirements.
Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Provide documentation, training, and support to ensure end-users can effectively use the tool and reports.




Qualifications:




4+ years of experience in business analysis, data analysis, or a similar analytical role
Expert-level proficiency in Excel, including advanced formulas, pivot tables, macros, and VBA
Expert-level proficiency in SQL for querying, data transformation, and analysis
Strong experience with Databricks and other SQL-based platforms for large-scale data processing and analytics
Proven track record of automating processes and improving data pipelines to drive efficiency and scalability
Strong problem-solving skills and keen attention to detail
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
Proficiency in Tableau for data visualization and dashboard development







Preferred Skills:




Experience with Python, SQL, or Spark for data manipulation and automation.
Knowledge of cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud.
Familiarity with API integrations and data governance best practices.







Equal Opportunity Statement: Include a statement on commitment to diversity and inclusivity.
