Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Farfetch is a leading global marketplace for the luxury fashion industry. The Farfetch Marketplace connects customers in over 190 countries and territories with items from more than 50 countries and over 1,400 of the world’s best brands, boutiques, and department stores, delivering a truly unique shopping experience and access to the most extensive selection of luxury on a global marketplace.

OPERATIONS
We're passionate about operational excellence, acting with our customers and partners always in our heart. Covering the entire order journey, we create our online content, secure payments and fraud process compliance, ensure order fulfilment and delivery, while providing customer and partner care. In a nutshell, we love to create seamless and memorable luxury experiences for our customers all around the world.

PORTO
Our office is near Porto, in the north of Portugal, and is located in a vibrant business hub. It offers a dynamic and welcoming environment where our employees can connect and network with a large community of tech professionals.

THE ROLE
Reporting to the Analytics Manager, you’ll help solve complex data challenges and work with a wide range of tools to build accurate, scalable and innovative data solutions. With your analytical expertise and strong problem solving skills you’ll help the FintechOps department make better decisions with data!

What You'll Do


Tackle complex data problems with a variety of tools and implement innovative and scalable solutions
Leverage your proficiency in tools such as BigQuery, dbt and Python to efficiently extract and transform raw datasets into structured and usable formats
Build and maintain data models, reports and dashboards in BigQuery and Looker to provide stakeholders with relevant and timely information
Apply advanced statistical and analytical techniques to extract meaningful insights from large datasets
Proactively identify and resolve data-related issues, ensuring the reliability and integrity of analytical outputs
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and to implement data-driven solutions
Communicate complex findings in a clear and understandable manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders





Who You Are


A bachelor's degree and a minimum of five years of relevant experience are required. Equivalent combinations of education and experience will be considered
Proficiency in SQL (SQL Server, BigQuery, or similar)
Experience using data visualisation tools (Looker, PowerBI, Tableau, or similar)
Knowledge of statistical programming languages like Python and/or R
Ability to work autonomously in solving complex technical problems
Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and quality
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey technical concepts to a non-technical audience
Advanced in English, both written and oral





Rewards & Benefits


Health insurance for the whole family, flexible working environment and well-being support and tools
Extra days off, sabbatical program and days for you to give back for the community
Training opportunities and free access to Udemy
Flexible benefits program





EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES STATEMENT


FARFETCH is committed to being an inclusive workplace where diversity in all its forms is celebrated. We make employment decisions without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, marital status, medical condition as defined by state law, physical or mental disability, military service or veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, genetic information or any other classification protected by applicable federal, state or local laws or ordinances. If you require special accommodation, please let us know





SCAM DISCLAIMER


It has come to our attention that there may be fraudulent activities involving individuals or organizations falsely claiming to represent Farfetch in order to attract candidates to a SCAM. Please be aware that Farfetch does not conduct recruitment processes through messaging apps or any unofficial communication channels, other than our official careers website. Additionally, Farfetch will never ask candidates for any form of payment during the recruitment process

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst - B2B Contract - Candidates must be based in Portugal




Location: Portugal (Fully remote)

Type: Contract




Currently partnered with a Global Software Engineering Company on the lookout for a Data Analyst!




About the Role:

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst with at least 5 years of experience to join a forward-thinking team. You’ll play a key role in developing data models, dashboards, and reports that drive strategic decisions. Working closely with stakeholders, you’ll define KPIs, standardize reporting, and transform complex datasets into actionable insights.




What You’ll Be Doing:

Designing and optimizing Power BI dashboards using DAX & Power Query

Writing and optimizing advanced SQL queries for data extraction and analysis

Developing robust data models to support decision-making processes

Standardizing KPIs and ensuring consistency across business units

Engaging with stakeholders to translate business needs into data solutions




Skills:

5+ years of experience in data analytics

Expertise in Power BI (DAX, Power Query) and SQL

Strong background in data modeling and analysis

Experience in dashboard & report development

Excellent stakeholder communication skills




Interview Process:

Intro Call – 30 min

Technical Exercise

Technical Interview – 2 hours

Cultural Fit Interview – 1 hour




If you’re looking for an opportunity to work on exciting projects, apply now!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Poq




Join Poq, the 'super app' SaaS company that empowers retailers and brands to drive fast growth and revolutionise their customer experience through highly effective and fully customisable mobile native apps.




As a member of our team, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of retail by enabling brands to provide a superior shopping and engagement experience - anytime, anywhere.




At Poq, we collaborate with retailers to build stronger brands, increase product sales, foster customer loyalty, and deliver highly relevant content, communications, and rewards. Our clients include global brands such as e.l.f. Cosmetics, Ardene, Cotton Traders, Card Factory, Kurt Geiger and many more!




With our apps serving consumers in the UK, US, Europe and Australia, you'll be at the forefront of driving international impact. Joining our team means gaining exposure to the latest and most progressive technologies in retail.




As a remote-first company, we offer a dynamic work environment that encourages collaboration and creativity. If you're passionate about pushing the boundaries of digital business-to-consumer (B2C) innovation and want to contribute to the growth of a forward-thinking company, Poq is the place for you.







About the role - Data Analyst




Reporting to the Head of RevOps, you will be joining the team as a Data Analyst where you’ll drive Poq’s data capabilities by automating data collection, building dashboards, and producing insightful reports. By analysing market trends and user behaviour, you’ll deliver strategic insights for marketing, customer success, and product enhancements. You’ll also support analytics setup for new customers, contribute to feature development, and provide monthly performance insights to inform campaigns and sales efforts, helping Poq make smarter, data-driven decisions.




Responsibilities




Dashboard & KPI Management: Design, maintain, and enhance dashboards and reports to track critical KPIs, including app engagement, retention, conversion rates, and revenue growth across our customer base.
Analytics Channel Ownership: Manage and prioritise incoming data requests via the internal analytics communication channel, ensuring timely and accurate delivery of insights.
Customer Analytics Setup: Assist Poq’s first-line support team in configuring analytics for new customer implementations to ensure seamless data tracking and reporting.
Market Research & Competitive Analysis: Conduct digital market research to analyse market share, user behaviour, and industry trends, comparing findings against Poq app performance for marketing, customer insights, and consultancy purposes.
Business Case Insights: Generate data-driven insights to support feature business cases by assessing uplifts in key KPIs associated with user experience improvements
Monthly/Quarterly Insights & Performance Report: Support the relaunch of Poq’s quarterly app insights and performance report, enhancing brand credibility, aligning with the marketing content strategy, and adding value to sales collateral.
Support Customer Success by providing insights into client app performance and identifying key drivers of app adoption, feature usage, and overall app success.
Team Player Mentality: Proven ability to collaborate and communicate effectively within a team environment to drive data-driven initiatives.




Experience




2+ years of experience as a Data Analyst
Strong proficiency in Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics for tracking and analysing user behaviour.
Strong proficiency in Google Workspace tools such as Sheets, including advanced formulas and automation. Knowledge of recent AI advancements is a plus but not required.
Hands-on experience with business intelligence platforms such as Looker and Tableau. Knowledge of recent AI advancements is a plus but not required.
Familiarity with cloud-based enterprise data warehouse solutions, such as BigQuery.
Good understanding of SQL for querying and manipulating data.
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python is a plus
Solid understanding of mathematical concepts, including statistics and algebra, to analyze and interpret data effectively
Outstanding analytical skills for gathering, organizing, analyzing, and presenting large data sets with accuracy and attention to detail.
Strong aptitude for identifying challenges and applying data-driven solutions.
Previous experience or exposure to the retail or e-commerce industry, with an understanding of relevant metrics and trends.
Experience with native mobile app analytics is advantageous but not essential




Poq Values & Behaviours




Deliberate

We move forward constructively with integrity and purpose
We bring the best version of ourselves every day
We are experts and innovators at the top of our game

Enterprising

We are ambitious, resilient and passionate about what we do
We are creative thinkers, problem solvers, decision-makers
We do great work and get things done together

Honourable

We take ownership and hold ourselves accountable
Take pride in our product, our work and each other
We are honest, decent, and do the right thing

Open

We are open to ideas, learning and evolving
We work together as one team
We celebrate and embrace our diversity

Title: Prácticas en Análisis de Datos y Power BI (Madrid) (12289)
Description:
Prácticas en Análisis de Datos y Power BI (Madrid)




Nuestro negocio de Redes de Electricidad España (UFD) está inmerso en un apasionante reto de transformación, que tiene como misión la digitalización y sensorización de nuestra red eléctrica para evolucionar de una red meramente física a una red virtual, donde el análisis de datos y la inteligencia artificial nos permitan gestionar y dar respuesta a todas las necesidades del nuevo ecosistema sostenible.




¡Queremos ser los mejores en lo que hacemos! Trabajando en equipo, haciendo más con menos y desarrollando a cada persona, para crecer juntos tanto en el ámbito de Redes Electricidad España como en el de otros negocios.




En este contexto ofrecemos una Beca en el negocio de Redes Electricidad España.




Estas prácticas te permitirán:

Participar en la elaboración de cuadros de mando en Power BI a partir de información de sistemas de UFD con el objetivo de disponer de KPIs que permitan hacer un seguimiento y análisis sobre el avance del proceso de control de calidad regulatoria.




Lo que necesitas:

Estudiante de último curso del grado en Ingeniería Industrial, Matemática, Física, Estadística o similares.
Conocimiento bases de datos
Conocimiento de PowerBI




Lo que ofrecemos:

Ayuda al estudio
Lugar de realización de las prácticas en Madrid, presencialmente en las oficinas de AV. de América 38




1) Rellena el formulario con tus datos. No olvides adjuntar tu CV actualizado.

2) Si te encuentras entre los perfiles más ajustados, contactaremos contigo para participar en las diferentes pruebas y entrevistas.

3) Si avanzas con éxito en el proceso………. ¡podrás formarte con el equipo Naturgy!

Title: Analista de dados
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?




Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.




Developing projects in the most diverse industries – Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation, among others –, we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home, providing our people with the means, opportunities and support they need to thrive and innovate.




We seek a Data Analyst willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team.




*For this position, you must have a residency in Porto or Lisbon.




Are you the one?




🔹 Responsibilities:

Analyze and interpret large datasets to generate valuable insights 💡
Create interactive reports and dashboards to support decision-making 📈
Collaborate closely with teams across different areas to solve strategic challenges 🤝
Ensure data quality and integrity 🔒




Requirements:

Experience with tools like Excel, SQL, Power BI, or Tableau 🖥️
Knowledge of Google Analytics and Big Data is a plus 🔍
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail 🔎
Good communication skills and ability to work in a team 🗣️




We believe we are the ones to, by:

🔹Providing a multidisciplinary Team.

🔹Giving a home office kit with everything you need to perform remotely.

🔹Ensuring a career plan alongside professional growth.

🔹Providing you with a custom training plan.

🔹Helping you reach happiness.




Oh… and by the way, we also have:

🔹Several challenging complex projects.

🔹Stimulating teams and leaders.

🔹World-class Clients and Partners.




If you believe in this match as much as we do, send us your CV to margarida.novais@closer.pt and reach the closer side of life.




Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.




At Closer, we embrace the unique perspectives and experiences that everyone brings, and we believe that it is a fundamental driver for the success we've achieved.

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI
Description:
En Claire Joster somos especialistas en la selección de perfiles directivos y mandos intermedios para las principales áreas funcionales, con un valor añadido fundamental: la captación de talento, basada en valores y ajuste cultural de nuestros clientes y candidatos.




Actualmente estamos buscando un perfil de Data Analyst para un partner tecnológico especializado en diseño y ejecución de soluciones tecnológicas en colaboración con importantes clientes, con dos pilares fundamentales: excelencia e innovación.




Funciones:

Recopilación de datos: Recolectar datos de diversas fuentes, como bases de datos, hojas de cálculo, y sistemas de gestión.
Limpieza y preparación de datos: Asegurarse de que los datos estén limpios y listos para el análisis, eliminando duplicados, corrigiendo errores y manejando valores faltantes.
Análisis de datos: Utilizar herramientas y técnicas estadísticas para analizar los datos y extraer información relevante. Esto puede incluir el uso de software como Excel, SQL.
Visualización de datos: Crear gráficos y visualizaciones que ayuden a comunicar los hallazgos de manera clara y comprensible con POWER BI.
Interpretación de resultados: Traducir los datos y los análisis en información útil para la toma de decisiones. Esto implica explicar los hallazgos a las partes interesadas no técnicas.
Generación de informes: Preparar informes detallados que resuman los hallazgos y recomendaciones basadas en los datos analizados.
Colaboración con otros equipos: Trabajar en conjunto con otros departamentos, como marketing, ventas, y desarrollo de productos, para entender sus necesidades de datos y proporcionarles la información que necesitan.
Monitoreo y mantenimiento de datos: Asegurar la integridad y la seguridad de los datos a lo largo del tiempo, y actualizar los sistemas de datos según sea necesario.




Requisitos:

Al menos 2 años de experiencia profesional como Analista de Datos.
Titulación en un campo cuantitativo (Informática, Ingeniería, Matemáticas, Física, etc…) o similar.
Capacidad de comunicación eficaz y capacidad para trabajar con otros departamentos.
Pensamiento lógico y resolutivo.
Dominio de SQL (SQL Server, Postgres).
Experiencia de trabajo con sistemas BI y herramientas de visualización.
2 años de experiencia en Power BI.
Usuario competente del paquete MS Office y usuario experto de Excel.




Se Ofrece:

Contrato indefinido y posibilidad de crecimiento.
Ubicación del cliente: Arturo Soria.
Modalidad Presencial.
Beneficios Sociales: Seguro médico.




Creemos en el talento único de cada persona y sabemos que la diversidad aporta valor a los equipos, impulsando organizaciones más innovadoras, creativas y eficientes. Por eso, como parte de Eurofirms Group, y de acuerdo con nuestra cultura People first, trabajamos para generar entornos laborales inclusivos en los que cada individuo pueda crecer y desarrollar su mejor versión. Asimismo, buscamos actuar como agentes de cambio para promover la igualdad de oportunidades en nuestro entorno, fomentando el respeto y apostando por la diversidad en todas sus formas.




Seas como seas y sientas como sientas, en Claire Joster tendrás un sitio para brillar.

Title: Data Analyst – Material
Description:
At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com

Job Function

Data Analytics & Computational Sciences

Job Sub Function

Business Intelligence

Job Category

Professional

All Job Posting Locations:

Beerse, Antwerp, Belgium, Geel, Antwerp, Belgium, Latina, Italy

Job Description

Master Data team on transcend Pharm is hiring a resource for the following open role: Material Master Data Analyst. This position will report to Material Master Data DPO and can be located in Latina IT, Beerse BE

Roles And Responsibilities


Support the Material Master DPO (Design & Process Owner) and Workstream during all phases of the program: design & build, execution and deployment
Drive workshops to collect and record user requirements for S4Hana Material configuration, Material workflow configuration and Data Quality
Participate in design workshops with Transcend functional teams to define design requirements for Material Master
Perform data profiling in legacy ERPs.
Identify data harmonization and data de-duplication needs for Materials in legacy ERPs.
Support Data Migration team with user requirement for Material Master Data conversions.
Support Data Migration team with pre and post load validation of Material master data during each testing cycle and at Cutover.
Support Workflow deployment team with requirements, design and testing of Material master data workflows.
Create user requirements, test scripts and defects in JIRA and /or Smartsheet.
Create KDDs and Functional documentations for S4Hana design, for Material master.
Perform FIT and BST testing of Material Master Data configuration in SAP.
Perform FIT and BST testing of Material Master Data workflow scenarios.
Support Business SMEs with UAT prep and execution.
Coordination of Dual Data Maintenance activities.
Support Data Ops team during Hypercare


Qualifications


Experience with SAP Material master data required. Other SAP objects preferred.
Experience with ERP deployments is a plus.
5+ years of Supply Chain experience in any functional area.
3+ years of experience with Materials master data.
Good understanding of NPI (new product introduction) in Pharm industry.
Data migration experience in SAP is a plus.
Expert in Excel (create formulas, macros, pivot tables, advanced filters and charts)
Proficient in SQL, Phyton or other data interrogation tools
Experience with Data Quality, Profiling and Cleansing, Data harmonization
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to travel internationally 10% of time.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for an opportunity to accelerate their career…




They're looking for a Senior Analytics Engineer , to join them in their office in Utrecht, for where you would be responsible for playing a key role in designing, building, and maintaining ELT pipelines using a modern technology toolkit, Collaborate with stakeholders to drive data-informed decision-making processes. Develop and enhance visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau

You must be experienced in :

Proven experience in building and maintaining data pipelines and ETL processes.
Hands-on experience with dbt (data build tool)
Advanced SQL skills and intermediate Python proficiency.
Strong expertise in visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau)
Proficiency in Dutch and English

Would you like to hear more about the opportunity?

Apply or reach out directly so we can discuss it in more detail.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

What You Will Do

As Data Scientist in the Data Analytics and Machine Learning team, you will be responsible for understanding customer usage and performance of our products and for providing solutions throughout the entire product life cycle including pre-, during- and post- development phases.


You will make meaningful interpretations, recommendations and eventually predictions from the data available from various sources to support our endeavor in moving towards data driven development
Analyze data from test trucks/rig tests to provide quick feedback to the test engineers to ascertain the expected working of the thermal management systems in the trucks
Develop intelligent dashboards that will help the test engineers to analyze the performance of the thermal system or indicate wrong readings in real time during tests
Introduce real time interactive capabilities in the dashboards with automation functionalities for extraction of relevant data for various stakeholders
Support the team to analyze big data from customer trucks to perform root cause analysis for customer product issues and provide a direction towards the solution
Create, validate and implement advanced truck thermal systems utilization algorithms and its performance trend monitoring tools to enhance predictive maintenance forecasting accuracy
Perform database queries to support engineering analysis and manage field issues
Support implementation of dashboards and BI solutions for internal and external customer reporting
Automating data pipelines and ioT pipelines that will lead to successful development and deployment of Digital Twins
Work towards edge computing and other concepts to deploy data analytics and ML techniques onboard the trucks to make quick decisions
Your role will strengthen our Global Thermal Management Sub-Stream and contribute to Volvo Group Trucks Technology vision within this technology area.


Who are you?

Do you dream big? We do too, and we are excited to grow together. 

Skills

To be successful in this role, we believe that you are a team player, high on energy, and are interested in working with global sites. You have an innovative and creative mindset to recommend engineering solutions and the willingness to learn and develop your own skills and abilities. In addition to this, you hold the below experience:


Bachelors/Masters in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical or Electronics Engineering, Computer Science Engineering or equivalent
Experience in data analytics, machine learning, edge or cloud computing, ioT, etc.
Ability to leverage analytical and quantitative skills to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, compare against physics-based models and complete root cause analysis
Excellent exposure to tools like Python
A passion for turning data into knowledge with great visualizations using Power BI or similar
Experience in advanced ML/statistical techniques such as regression analysis, neural networks, time series forecasting techniques, classification, clustering, feature reduction etc. especially in automotive applications
Experience/Knowledge in future technologies (e-MOB, Fuel Cell, H2 technologies)
Good in compiling and presenting information verbally and in writing.


Experience in systems, simulations and/or testing of automotive thermal systems is meritorious.

Ready for the next move?

If you want to make a real impact in your career, the transportation business is where you want to be. We look forward to meeting you.

For questions about the process, contact Erik Lindberg, Talent Acquisition Partner, at erik.lindberg.3@volvo.com. Our hiring manager is Tiago Rosso, Group Manager - Thermal Management, Data and Simulation.

Last application date: 18th of April 2025

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

Who We Are And What We Believe In

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join Volvo Group. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

Group Trucks Technology are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.
Show more

As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum’s team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum’s solutions aim at contributing to its clients’ performance and innovation as well as the common good.










About the Role




To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends through what data can tell. As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team.




Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understanding their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation).




You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving.




You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analyzing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic decisions.




You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholders' needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis.







Responsibilities







To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends through what data can tell.




As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team.




Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understanding their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation).




You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving.




You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analyzing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic decisions.




You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals.




It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholders' needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis.







Technical Skills:




Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields




Experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI




Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)




Proficiency in SQL




Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus




Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus




Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus




Language Skills:




Fluency in English




Soft Skills:




Be driven, enthusiastic and dynamic in search of improving processes, controls & procedure




Be pro-active, enthusiastic and able to work well in a team

  • You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving.


  • You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analyzing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic decisions.


  • You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholders' needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis.



Responsibilities



  • To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends through what data can tell.


  • As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team.


  • Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understanding their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation).


  • You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving.


  • You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analyzing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic decisions.


  • You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals.


  • It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stakeholders' needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis.



Technical Skills:


  • Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields


  • Experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI


  • Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)


  • Proficiency in SQL


  • Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus


  • Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus


  • Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus


Language Skills:


  • Fluency in English


Soft Skills:


  • Be driven, enthusiastic and dynamic in search of improving processes, controls & procedure


  • Be pro-active, enthusiastic and able to work well in a team

Title: PowerBI
HTML:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!

A nossa missão é ser uma parte significativa da carreira das nossas pessoas. À medida que crescemos, cresce também a determinação em oferecer a melhor experiência aos nossos colaboradores e clientes e é exatamente isso que nos move. Somos uma empresa portuguesa de consultoria tecnológica com escritórios em Lisboa, Porto e Óbidos e representações no Brasil e Tunísia. Contamos com mais de 13 anos de expertise no mercado, e hoje somos um universo de cerca de 400 pessoas a trabalhar em contexto presencial, remoto ou híbrido em projetos em mais de 20 países.

Acreditamos que grandes pessoas fazem empresas de sucesso e por isso mesmo defendemos a valorização, reconhecimento e crescimento dos nossos profissionais.

Não queremos ser mais uma linha do teu CV, queremos que connosco vivas uma Lifetime Experience. Apostamos em formações e certificações que confirmam a tua real progressão, na promoção de um saudável work-life balance e na oferta de benefícios com impacto na tua vida pessoal e carreira.

O que procuramos

  • Formação superior em Engenharia Informática ou semelhante;
  • Experiência profissional superior a 2 anos como BI;
  • Valorizamos a tua experiência, sobretudo com PowerBI e SQL;
  • Bons conhecimentos de inglês (mínimo B2).

Ser Affinity

  • #Affinidade – Criares relações de proximidade e empatia com colegas, clientes e candidatos (e não apenas com tecnologias, linguagens e plataformas). Espírito de equipa e boa disposição;
  • #Ambição – Quereres fazer mais e melhor. Vontade de exceder expectativas e evoluir pessoal e profissionalmente;
  • #Ação – Energia para fazer acontecer. Mostrares proatividade e capacidade de iniciativa;
  • #Aprendizagem – Vontade de evoluir individual e coletivamente e tornares-te um expert no mercado tecnológico.

A tua #LifetimeExperience

  • Participar em projetos nacionais e internacionais numa empresa baseada em relacionamentos pessoais, na simplicidade e na eficiência, com uma ação disruptiva no mercado tecnológico;
  • Aceder a um plano de carreira e formação personalizado e diretamente proporcional ao teu desempenho e interesse;
  • Fazer parte de um ambiente acolhedor, de confiança, respeito e informalidade;
  • Integrar as nossas Affinity Communities (de desporto, tecnologia, hobbies, etc.) e participar ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social e ambiental;
  • Tirar partido de um conjunto de benefícios, parcerias, descontos eventos e dinâmicas internas.

Para além da tua satisfação profissional queremos proporcionar-te oportunidades de lazer e convívio memoráveis e dignos de uma experiência Affinity.

Join the Experience!

Envia-nos a tua candidatura e aproveita para nos conhecer e ir acompanhando em:

https://www.instagram.com/affinityportugal/

https://www.linkedin.com/company/2701281/admin/

https://twitter.com/WithAffinity

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're looking for a detail-oriented Data Analyst with a focus on payments and success rate analytics. In this role, you'll use your expertise in Excel and data analytics to analyze payment data, monitor success rates, and provide insights that drive business performance and efficiency.

Responsibilities


Analyze payment data to identify trends and areas for improvement in success rates, transaction volumes, and customer behavior
Utilize Excel (VLOOKUP, PivotTables, Power Query) to clean and analyze large datasets
Provide ad-hoc data analysis to support decision-making across teams
Investigate payment data discrepancies and recommend improvements
Monitor payment system performance and report on success rates
Suggest improvements to enhance payment processes and user experience
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in payment analytics



Requirements


Advanced proficiency in Excel (VLOOKUP, PivotTables, etc.)
Experience in data analysis, particularly with payments or financial data
Ability to analyze large datasets and provide actionable insights
Knowledge of payment systems and transaction processing
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Experience with analytics tools (SQL, Power BI, Tableau) is a plus
Strong communication skills for presenting findings to non-technical stakeholders.



Preferred


Familiarity with payment gateways or fraud detection systems
Knowledge of Python or R for advanced analytics



Benefits


Spacious and modern office
Free parking space
Flexible working hours
Free lunch in the office
Social guarantees and health insurance
Company sponsored professional training, certifications ,and conferences
Social events - team building, corporate events
Friendly and experienced team members who will support your professional growth
Hybrid work
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
GROUP BNP PARIBAS

BNP Paribas Group is the top bank in the European Union and a major international banking establishment. It has close to 185,000 employees in 65 countries. In Spain we are more than 5,100 employees within 13 business lines.




Spain IT Production




Spain IT Production organization consists of CIB ITO & ITG IT Platforms and is responsible for providing IT Production services to our Clients in EMEA, ensuring a Digital Market evolution, in a secured and performant environment, and with a reliable quality. IT Production organisation includes Infrastructure services, Telecom & Workspace, Production Security and Application Production domains and associated transversal services (CTO Office, Control Tower, PMO and IT Continuity). In Spain, IT Production relies on a Platform with over 400 experts that provide full-stack support services ensuring a secure, stable, standardized, and efficient production.




ABOUT THE JOB




MISSION




For the Security Dashboard activities, we are looking for Data Security & Business Intelligence Engineer to support and coordinate the deployment of the Security Dashboard within the security productions of the BNPPARIBAS group




RESPONSIBILITIES




· Needs analysis for evolution of the current BI solution

· Provision of solutions in accordance with the company’s strategy based on (Cyber security Group requirements

· Coordinate the redesign and Dashboard transformation

· Deploy the solution within the group’s ProdSec entities of the group

· Ensure comitology with stakeholders (Technical Experts, Functional Experts, Product Owner, and customers.)

· Report to the manager and Team lead on the achievements progress.

· Ensuring the updating of the documentary heritage corpus




REQUIREMENTS




Studies




Bachelor’s in computer science or equivalent




Experience




Minimum 5 to 10 years of experience in cybersecurity and production environments




Languages




Fluent English written and spoken. Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communications skills.

French speaking is a plus.




SKILLS




Technical




o PowerBI, SQL, MS SSIS/ SSAS/ SSRS

o Python, PHP/ Symfony

o Systems: architecture, security, etc. to support monitoring and steering actions- définition, production et mise en place de KPI de pilotage et de suivi

o The methodology for monitoring Cybersecurity Control Projects;

o Vulnerability & Patch Management

o Qualys, Tanium is plus




Transversal & Behavioral




o Strong situational analysis and needs identification.

o Proposal force for the most relevant solutions

o Ability to collaborate with different types of profiles. Technical, Functional, Project Leadership. Team leader, etc.

o Ability to share and transmit.

o Rigor, organization and method with a spirit of analysis and synthesis

o Customer orientation: listening, support and understanding of needs.

o Transverse vision to anticipate data correlations / Impacts.

o Good Cyber Security Culture.




BENEFITS

• Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.

• Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).

• Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.

• Flexible compensation plan.

• Hybrid telecommuting model (50%).

• 31 vacation days.







Diversity and inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Title: Junior Analytics Consultant
Description:
Who are we?

For over 40 years, ProStrategy has been helping businesses to transform and grow through the delivery of ERP, Customer Engagement, Enterprise Performance Management and Data Analytics solutions from our offices in Cork & Dublin. As a leading Gold Microsoft Partner, we have been implementing business solutions for our clients across a variety of diverse industries.




Who are we looking for?

This is an outstanding opportunity for a junior data engineer with aspirations to move into a technical consulting role. This individual will have the opportunity to support several of our existing clients and the chance to develop their consultative skills by working on a variety of different projects.




What will you be doing?




Assist in the management and delivery of development tasks. Collaborate with Senior Consultants to understand project requirements and objectives.
Gather requirements from clients, generate estimates, functional specs, and review them with senior team
Work closely with the Project Manager, aiding in the identification of tasks and actions necessary for project delivery.
Resolve client UAT issues with guidance from more experienced staff.
Support the enforcement of coding standards among internal and external developers under the mentorship of senior consultants.
Cover data related technical support (first line on rotation)




Requirements:

Strong communication skills.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Maths or a related field.
Basic understanding of data engineering concepts and practices.
Familiarity with the Microsoft technology stack, including Fabric, SQL Server, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Database, and Power BI.
Knowledge of SQL and experience with database management and data modelling.
Exposure to ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools within the Microsoft ecosystem.
Show more

Who are we?

For over 40 years, ProStrategy has been helping businesses to transform and grow through the delivery of ERP, Customer Engagement, Enterprise Performance Management and Data Analytics solutions from our offices in Cork & Dublin. As a leading Gold Microsoft Partner, we have been implementing business solutions for our clients across a variety of diverse industries.


Who are we looking for?

This is an outstanding opportunity for a junior data engineer with aspirations to move into a technical consulting role. This individual will have the opportunity to support several of our existing clients and the chance to develop their consultative skills by working on a variety of different projects.


What will you be doing?


  • Assist in the management and delivery of development tasks. Collaborate with Senior Consultants to understand project requirements and objectives.
  • Gather requirements from clients, generate estimates, functional specs, and review them with senior team
  • Work closely with the Project Manager, aiding in the identification of tasks and actions necessary for project delivery.
  • Resolve client UAT issues with guidance from more experienced staff.
  • Support the enforcement of coding standards among internal and external developers under the mentorship of senior consultants.
  • Cover data related technical support (first line on rotation)


Requirements:

  • Strong communication skills.
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Maths or a related field.
  • Basic understanding of data engineering concepts and practices.
  • Familiarity with the Microsoft technology stack, including Fabric, SQL Server, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Database, and Power BI.
  • Knowledge of SQL and experience with database management and data modelling.
  • Exposure to ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools within the Microsoft ecosystem.

Title: Analista de Datos & BI
Description:
En esta posición, participarás en un equipo innovador donde cada análisis y modelo de datos contribuirá directamente a la toma de decisiones estratégicas. Trabajarás con herramientas punteras, creando informes y cuadros de mando que facilitarán la visualización y explotación de los datos.







💡 ¿Qué te ofrecemos?

✅ Incorporación inmediata con contrato indefinido.

✅ Formación continua para impulsar tu desarrollo profesional.

✅ Flexibilidad horaria y teletrabajo para una mejor conciliación.

✅ Posibilidad de trabajar de forma híbrida en nuestras sedes de Gran Canaria, Tenerife o Madrid, o de forma remota si tu residencia es diferente.







💡 ¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?

🔹 Definirás y desarrollarás modelos de datos, informes y cuadros de mando para proporcionar información clave a los negocios.

🔹 Analizarás los requerimientos de los usuarios de negocio, asegurando que el reporting y la analítica de datos respondan a sus necesidades.

🔹 Construirás ETLs para cargar información al DWH del grupo, facilitando el acceso a los datos mediante herramientas de visualización.

🔹 Mantendrás y evolucionarás los modelos de datos, permitiendo el autoconsumo por parte de los usuarios de negocio.

🔹 Monitorizarás y diagnosticarás posibles incidencias en la actualización y consulta de la información disponible.

🔹 Darás soporte a los usuarios para que comprendan y utilicen correctamente los datos.

🔹 Garantizarás la seguridad, ejecutando de manera rigurosa y eficiente las medidas necesarias para la protección de la información.







✔️ Requisitos imprescindibles:

✅ Formación universitaria en Ingeniería Informática, Matemáticas, Estadística, Física, Ingeniería Industrial o similar.

✅ Experiencia de 1 a 3 años en un puesto similar.

✅ Nivel de inglés suficiente para desenvolverte en un entorno profesional.







✨ Además, valoramos positivamente si cuentas con:

🔹 Conocimientos en lenguajes propios del BI y Big Data: SQL y DAX.

🔹 Conocimientos en estadística, algoritmos, análisis de datos y tecnologías de almacenamiento e integración de datos.

🔹 Experiencia en analítica avanzada y aprendizaje automático con tecnologías Big Data.

🔹 Manejo de otros lenguajes como Python, PySpark o lenguaje M (Power Query).

🔹 Uso de herramientas de visualización como Power BI, Qlik, Tableau, etc.

🔹 Familiaridad con ecosistemas y metodologías como Azure, Databricks, DevOps, GIT o Power Platform (Power Automate y Power Apps).

🔹 Conocimientos en protección de datos y seguridad de la información.







Buscamos a alguien con mentalidad analítica, iniciativa y pasión por la transformación digital. Si cumples con el perfil y quieres crecer en un entorno dinámico, ¡queremos conocerte!




🚀 Si te apasionan los datos y quieres impulsar tu carrera en un entorno dinámico, ¡esta es tu oportunidad!




Las personas que concurran a los procesos de selección y evaluación serán valoradas en base a los requisitos del puesto de trabajo con objetividad, transparencia y respetando el principio de igualdad de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.


Neotalent, the responsive people.

Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.



Role Overview:

We are currently recruiting a Data Analyst to integrate an international project in the corporate banking sector. The client in question is one of the biggest banks in Europe, with activity in over 75 countries around the world, it also counts with over 175 years of existence which means that is an extremely consolidated player in the banking industry.


What you will do:

You will be part of an international and diverse team supporting the Global Markets Front Office in understanding their clients, identifying opportunities, and uncovering trends through data analysis. Your role will involve working closely with various business areas within the bank, providing valuable insights to drive business growth by understanding their needs and implementing data-driven solutions, including analysis, visualization, and automation. You will be responsible for retrieving, preparing, and analyzing complex datasets using statistical models and best practices in data visualization to create reports and develop automated tools that support strategic decision-making. Additionally, you will bridge technical and non-technical areas, ensuring clear communication between stakeholders and the technical team by translating business needs into technical requirements and effectively presenting complex analysis results.


What you are like:

  • Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields;
  • Experience in data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI;
  • Experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas);
  • Proficiency in SQL;
  • Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus;
  • Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus;
  • Strong organizational and planning skills;
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Proficiency in English (mandatory).


Why join us:

  • Work on challenging projects for big clients;
  • Learn more about emerging technologies;
  • Possibility of working remotely;
  • Design your career plan;
  • Access to continuous training and certifications;
  • Evolve through our internal mobility program;
  • … and much more!

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst that want to play a key role in shaping data-driven insights and deliver functional Power BI solutions? Do you want to support one of Europe’s largest residential portfolios, providing essential data insights to business users? Then this role with us, may be your next step!







The Team

Join the AnalytiX team as our Data Analyst and contribute to our mission of delivering innovative Power BI solutions and automating manual data processes. You’ll be part of a cross-functional team consisting of data engineers, data analysts. You’ll have opportunities to collaborate across Data & AnalytiX function, where our shared passion for data drives us toward common goals of quality and ensuring satisfaction with our products.

This full-time position is based in either our Copenhagen group office.







Key Responsibilities:

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role on delivering visually appealing, functional, and high-quality Power BI reports and ensuring adoption by connecting with end-users of the solutions.




your core responsibilities encompass:

Develop, maintain and fine-tune Power BI reports to meet business needs
Provide proactive maintenance of current solutions while optimizing them for better performance
Document solution designs and workflow in Miro for clear communication and alignment
Take part in developing data models that enable self-service BI
Facilitate discussions and meetings with product owners to understand business needs and align solutions accordingly
Ensure the smooth transition of existing solutions to a more scalable and future-proof setup
Contribute to the technical debt management of the Power BI platform and ensure best practices







To fit this role, we look for you who has:

Minimum Bachelor’s degree in relevant fields
Strong passion for statistics and data analysis, and experience with large datasets and dimensional modelling.
Knowledge of ETL tools and data processing techniques.
Experience with data warehousing, data modeling and DAX programming.
Ability to work within an agile setup and prioritize tasks efficiently.
Confidence in engaging with stakeholders across various functions and asking insightful questions.
Fluent in English; Strong verbal/written communication and presentation skills.




You have a systematic, analytical mindset. As a person you are naturally curious about new methods and technologies, enabling effective interaction with both technical and business teams (with the ability to translate tech lingo to something non-tech people can understand). You immediately take our values, Care, Dare, Share to your heart and enjoy working in an informal atmosphere where flexibility and responsibility goes hand in hand.










Join Us

Joining Heimstaden means being part of a team that dreams big, works passionately, and continuously strives for improvement.




We celebrate talent in all its forms and encourage you to apply, even if you don’t meet every qualification listed. Let’s explore together how your unique strengths can contribute to our shared goals.

Apply today to connect with the People & Culture team to further explore this opportunity!







We will initiate conversations with selected candidates prior to the application deadline.

We conduct background checks as part of our recruitment process. If you have any questions regarding this, you are welcome to contact us.




We know the value of challenging unconscious bias and the importance of focusing on the full potential and competences of each individual. That is why we do not require a cover letter when applying to our positions, and we use testing as a tool in the process.

For questions, please contact Franco Hurtado at franco.hurtado@heimstaden.com

Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
Who we are:

Want to make an impact? Join our pack and come work (and play!) with us.

We believe everyone deserves the unconditional love of a pet—and at Rover, our mission is to make it easier to experience that love. Founded in 2011, the Rover app and website connect dog and cat parents with loving pet sitters and dog walkers in neighborhoods across the US, Canada, and Europe. We empower our community of trusted pet sitters and dog walkers to run their own pet care businesses on Rover with the tools and security of a global company to back them.

Headquartered in Seattle, Washington, we work closely with our teams in Barcelona, San Antonio, Spokane, and remote locations. We’ve got a reputation for being a great place to work, having been named among the 100 Best Companies to Work For in Seattle Business Magazine and Washington’s Best Workplaces in the Puget Sound Business Journal. We're an agile, fast-growing company, and our leadership comes from some of the world's most respected tech companies.

At Rover, our furry coworkers are just as important as our human ones—and we wouldn’t have it any other way. Along with making the joys of pet parenthood more accessible, we’re committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming community of pet people—and that starts with our employees.

Who we're looking for:

The Marketing Analytics team supports the company’s marketing efforts, while also working with teams throughout the organization. The analytics team is responsible for a number of business-critical reports and data models that our global marketing teams rely on for daily reporting, budgeting, and analysis. We measure marketing attribution to understand how people become Rover customers, provide campaign reporting to monitor trends in cost efficiency and optimization, deliver lifecycle data to action against a variety of customer behaviors, and narrate the business to identify and prioritize new opportunities.

We are looking for an Analyst to support our Growth, International Expansion, Lifecycle, and SEO stakeholders with a focus on improving our reporting and dashboard structure. The ideal candidate will have experience working closely with business stakeholders and building data-driven narratives that enable clear decision making.

Your Responsibilities:


Work closely with analytics peers and marketing teams to narrate trends and insights, with a particular focus on our customer acquisition marketing programs
Design reports and dashboards that enable clear, data-driven decision-making for marketing and cross-functional teams
Refine our marketing attribution models to drive optimal resource allocation across paid and organic marketing channels
Expand your expertise by supporting experiments such as A/B testing and Market Match tests to optimize strategies across multiple marketing functions



Your Qualifications:


At least 2 years experience working with complex datasets to support business decision making
Fluency in SQL
Data visualisation tool experience (e.g. Mode, Looker, Tableau, etc.)
Ability to adapt your communication style to translate complex data insights for different audiences.
You have experience in owning small-to-medium projects from design to completion with limited guidance from your manager
You understand when you are blocked, proactively seeking out for help within the team or the organization to move the project forward



Nice to Have:


Python or R familiarity is helpful, but we welcome candidates eager to develop these skills
Experience evaluating results of A/B tests as well as expertise in statistical analysis
Understanding of marketing metrics such as clicks, CPC, CTR, impressions, and unit economics like customer LTV, payback period, and CAC



Benefits of working at Rover:


Competitive compensation
Long-term incentive plan with a company performance-based cash payout
Permanent contract
Pension Plan
Meal tickets through Cobee
Generous PTO Allowance
Hybrid schedule
Private health insurance
Discounted Gym Membership
Bring your dog to work (and unlimited puppy time)
Monetary help for adopting a dog plus yearly credit to use on our platform
Flexible work hours, sometimes you’ll need to be in at certain times, but on the whole, we’re pretty flexible when it comes to managing workload and time
Grab snacks, fresh fruit, in our kitchen to keep yourself going
Regular team activities, including happy hours, game nights, and more



Rover is an equal-opportunity employer committed to promoting a diverse, inclusive, and inventive environment with the best employees. We’re driven by seeing our people succeed and grow, and we work to ensure everyone contributes to their fullest potential. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, protected veteran status, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Analyst for a project based in Porto (Hybrid work model - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

• BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;

• Experience in data preparation and data reconciliation (mandatory);

• Experience in Alteryx and VBA;

• Power BI Experience;

• Good knowledge of SQL (mandatory);

• Good knowledge of Agile and Scrum methodologies;

• Fluent English (mandatory);

• The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🚀Are you the NEX T Data Analyst?🚀

What we value:

4+ years of experience in IT roles.
Proven experience in Alteryx and VBA
Strong SQL knowledge.
Good communication skills and ability to work closely with business users
Fluency in English (minimum B2 level).
Experience with Power BI.

📍 Porto

💻 Hybrid

Collaborating with business users to understand and address their needs.
Translating business requirements into Alteryx workflows.

What we offer you:

Dynamic and professional team;
Opportunity to participate in local or international projects;
Personalized support;
Training plan tailored to your needs;
Career progression and development guidance;
Opportunity to be part of a rapidly growing team.




Share your CV to your@nextengineering.pt with reference AOL.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about data & analytics and are you energized by building Power BI dashboards with an eye for design that clearly present relevant information? Moreover, do you enjoy working on the most innovative data solutions of the future? Then a role as a Power BI Data Analyst within our Data & AI team might interest you!




What you will do:

In your role as Power BI Data Analyst, you will work closely with experienced colleagues on Business Intelligence, Big Data and AI projects. These projects are mainly carried out in the Microsoft Cloud.
Using your analytical insight, you will help transform raw data into insightful information by developing user-friendly Power BI dashboards.
You analyze the client's needs and form the bridge between business users and data engineers.
You provide the customer with new insights by developing easy to understand data visualizations.
You are very good in giving demos to our customers.
Innovation and knowledge sharing are high on our agenda. We are always looking for innovation and improvement at our customers. You will get plenty of opportunities to actively participate in this.
You will join a close, driven and passionate team where it is pleasant and fun to work.




What you need to succeed:

You have a bachelor or master degree, preferably in the field of (Business) Computer Science or Business IT & Management or a related field.
You have several years of experience as a Data Analyst and Power BI holds no secrets for you.
You are passionate about data driven solutions.
Knowledge of technology in data engineering and data warehouses is a plus. Knowledge of programming languages such as Python is also a plus.
You have (or wish to have) a Microsoft Certified Professional certification.
You build impactful dashboards like no other and you get energy from storytelling.
You bring with you a flexible, independent and collegial attitude.
Good communication skills, customer focus and accuracy are also very important in this role.




What we offer:

22 Annual Vacation days, 3 sick days that are not carried over the next year (no medical certificate required), plus a seniority day added every 3 years in the company
Meal tickets
Private Medical Insurance
Budget for trainings and certifications
We offer flexibility when it comes to WFH policy
Wellbeing at the center - we know that there is more to our lives than our jobs, therefore we make sure to tackle well-being aspects of our day-to-day lives through specialized sessions, webinars, and internal programs according to our employee's input
In close cooperation is a value we live by, through #MomentsThatMatter: monthly hangout parties, team buildings, gamified online experiences
Many more to come :)

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!


A nossa missão é ser uma parte significativa da carreira das nossas pessoas. À medida que crescemos, cresce também a determinação em oferecer a melhor experiência aos nossos colaboradores e clientes e é exatamente isso que nos move. Somos uma empresa portuguesa de consultoria tecnológica com escritórios em Lisboa, Porto e Óbidos e representações no Brasil e Tunísia. Contamos com mais de 11 anos de expertise no mercado, e hoje somos um universo de cerca de 400 pessoas a trabalhar em contexto presencial, remoto ou híbrido em projetos em mais de 20 países.

Acreditamos que grandes pessoas fazem empresas de sucesso e por isso mesmo defendemos a valorização, reconhecimento e crescimento dos nossos profissionais.

Não queremos ser mais uma linha do teu CV, queremos que connosco vivas uma Lifetime Experience. Apostamos em formações e certificações que confirmam a tua real progressão, na promoção de um saudável work-life balance e na oferta de benefícios com impacto na tua vida pessoal e carreira.

O que procuramos

  • Formação superior em Engenharia Informática ou similar (valorizado);
  • Experiência mínima de 2 anos com PowerBI;
  • Domínio de ferramentas Microsoft Office (preferencialmente Access e Excel);
  • Bons conhecimentos de inglês (mínimo B2).

Ser Affinity

  • #Affinidade – Criares relações de proximidade e empatia com colegas, clientes e candidatos (e não apenas com tecnologias, linguagens e plataformas). Espírito de equipa e boa disposição;
  • #Ambição – Quereres fazer mais e melhor. Vontade de exceder expectativas e evoluir pessoal e profissionalmente;
  • #Ação – Energia para fazer acontecer. Mostrares proatividade e capacidade de iniciativa;
  • #Aprendizagem – Vontade de evoluir individual e coletivamente e tornares-te um expert no mercado tecnológico.


A tua #LifetimeExperience

  • Participar em projetos nacionais e internacionais numa empresa baseada em relacionamentos pessoais, na simplicidade e na eficiência, com uma ação disruptiva no mercado tecnológico;
  • Aceder a um plano de carreira e formação personalizado e diretamente proporcional ao teu desempenho e interesse;
  • Fazer parte de um ambiente acolhedor, de confiança, respeito e informalidade;
  • Integrar as nossas Affinity Communities (de desporto, tecnologia, hobbies, etc.) e participar ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social e ambiental;
  • Tirar partido de um conjunto de benefícios, parcerias, descontos eventos e dinâmicas internas.

Para além da tua satisfação profissional queremos proporcionar-te oportunidades de lazer e convívio memoráveis e dignos de uma experiência Affinity.

Join the Experience!


Envia-nos a tua candidatura e aproveita para nos conhecer e ir acompanhando em:

https://www.instagram.com/affinityportugal/

https://www.linkedin.com/company/2701281/admin/

https://twitter.com/WithAffinity

Title: Analista ESG – Dati e Reporting - STAGE
Description:
Iper, La grande i,

Azienda italiana leader della Distribuzione Moderna Organizzata (DMO), ricerca per la propria sede di Milano (MI) un/a Analista ESG – Dati e Reporting in STAGE

Posizione:

Il Gruppo Finiper Canova è alla ricerca di un/una Analista ESG in STAGE per supportare il team nella gestione dei dati ESG, nell’analisi e nella reportistica.

La figura si occuperà, in supporto ai colleghi, di analizzare e monitorare le performance ESG aziendali, supportando anche la gestione di progetti legati alla sostenibilità.

Responsabilità:


Raccogliere, elaborare e analizzare dati ESG per misurare le performance aziendali e identificare opportunità di miglioramento.
Supportare la redazione dei report ESG (ad esempio, Bilancio di Sostenibilità, reporting GRI, TCFD, ecc.) per stakeholder interni ed esterni.
Garantire l'accuratezza e l'affidabilità dei dati ESG, collaborando con altri dipartimenti per ottenere le informazioni necessarie.
Supportare la gestione di progetti di sostenibilità, come iniziative di economia circolare, efficienza energetica o engagement dei dipendenti.
Monitorare e aggiornare il team sulle evoluzioni normative e sugli standard di settore legati alla rendicontazione ESG.
Contribuire alla creazione di dashboard e strumenti di visualizzazione dei dati per comunicare in modo chiaro e trasparente le prestazioni ESG.
Partecipare alla promozione di una cultura della sostenibilità all'interno dell’organizzazione.

Requisiti:


Laurea in Economia, Scienze Ambientali, Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini.
Buona conoscenza degli standard di reporting ESG (es. GRI, SASB, TCFD) e dei nuovi indicatori ESRS previsti dalla CSRD.
Eccellenti capacità analitiche, con padronanza di strumenti come Excel, Power BI o altri software di analisi dati.
Precisione e attenzione ai dettagli, con capacità organizzative e di gestione documentale.
Ottime capacità comunicative, scritte e orali, con predisposizione al lavoro in team.

Esperienza di 1 anno in ambito ESG, sostenibilità o analisi dei dati (anche attraverso stage o tirocini) verrà considerata un plus.

Altre informazioni:

La selezione è rivolta a candidati dell’uno e dell’altro sesso ai sensi del D. Lgs. 198/2006. Tutte le candidature devono essere accompagnate dalla autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali e saranno gestite ai sensi del Regolamento Europeo 2016/679 ( c.d. GDPR).

Per ulteriori informazioni circa le opportunità professionali ed il mondo di Iper, La grande i diventa follower della nostra pagina Linkedin (click su "Segui" al link https://www.linkedin.com/company-beta/152414/)
Show more
HTML:
Iper, La grande i,

Azienda italiana leader della Distribuzione Moderna Organizzata (DMO), ricerca per la propria sede di Milano (MI) un/a Analista ESG – Dati e Reporting in STAGE

Posizione:

Il Gruppo Finiper Canova è alla ricerca di un/una Analista ESG in STAGE per supportare il team nella gestione dei dati ESG, nell’analisi e nella reportistica.

La figura si occuperà, in supporto ai colleghi, di analizzare e monitorare le performance ESG aziendali, supportando anche la gestione di progetti legati alla sostenibilità.

Responsabilità:

    • Raccogliere, elaborare e analizzare dati ESG per misurare le performance aziendali e identificare opportunità di miglioramento.
    • Supportare la redazione dei report ESG (ad esempio, Bilancio di Sostenibilità, reporting GRI, TCFD, ecc.) per stakeholder interni ed esterni.
    • Garantire l'accuratezza e l'affidabilità dei dati ESG, collaborando con altri dipartimenti per ottenere le informazioni necessarie.
    • Supportare la gestione di progetti di sostenibilità, come iniziative di economia circolare, efficienza energetica o engagement dei dipendenti.
    • Monitorare e aggiornare il team sulle evoluzioni normative e sugli standard di settore legati alla rendicontazione ESG.
    • Contribuire alla creazione di dashboard e strumenti di visualizzazione dei dati per comunicare in modo chiaro e trasparente le prestazioni ESG.
    • Partecipare alla promozione di una cultura della sostenibilità all'interno dell’organizzazione.
Requisiti:

    • Laurea in Economia, Scienze Ambientali, Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini.
    • Buona conoscenza degli standard di reporting ESG (es. GRI, SASB, TCFD) e dei nuovi indicatori ESRS previsti dalla CSRD.
    • Eccellenti capacità analitiche, con padronanza di strumenti come Excel, Power BI o altri software di analisi dati.
    • Precisione e attenzione ai dettagli, con capacità organizzative e di gestione documentale.
    • Ottime capacità comunicative, scritte e orali, con predisposizione al lavoro in team.
Esperienza di 1 anno in ambito ESG, sostenibilità o analisi dei dati (anche attraverso stage o tirocini) verrà considerata un plus.

Altre informazioni:

La selezione è rivolta a candidati dell’uno e dell’altro sesso ai sensi del D. Lgs. 198/2006. Tutte le candidature devono essere accompagnate dalla autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali e saranno gestite ai sensi del Regolamento Europeo 2016/679 ( c.d. GDPR).

Per ulteriori informazioni circa le opportunità professionali ed il mondo di Iper, La grande i diventa follower della nostra pagina Linkedin (click su "Segui" al link https://www.linkedin.com/company-beta/152414/)

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Somos Métrica, una consultora de negocio, integración de sistemas, servicios y soluciones IT, comprometida con la Sociedad de la información y el desarrollo tecnológico.




Desde Métrica, estamos buscando un Data Scientist o Analista de Datos con al menos 2 años de experiencia para un proyecto de un importante cliente.




El candidato ideal deberá contar con los siguientes conocimientos:

Experiencia en análisis de datos y desarrollo de algoritmos que automaticen el procesamiento para mejorar predicciones.
Manejo de herramientas BI como Tableau, Power BI.
Lenguajes de programación y análisis como Python, R, Scala y SQL.
Deseables conocimientos en Snowflake.
Inglés medio deseable.




¿Qué ofrecemos? 😎

📰 Contratación indefinida.

🏥 Retribución flexible.

👩‍🎓 Formación en áreas de interés.

👨‍💻 Modalidad híbrida: presencial 2 días a la semana en las oficinas del cliente (zona Delicias).

💶 Salario competitivo




En Métrica queremos ayudarte a conseguir el cambio que estás buscando.

Si crees que puedes encajar, inscríbete o contáctanos!
